title: confess-47_(arknights)
body: A playable Vanguard operator in [[Arknights]].

title: blue_screen_of_death
body:
The "blue screen of death" appears in case of a fatal system error response (a.k.a. "crash") in many versions of the [[Microsoft Windows]] operating system.

h4.See also
* [[error message]]
* [[red ring of death]]
* [[test card]] (for TVs)
* [[glitch]]
* [[kernel panic]]
* [[2024 crowdstrike incident]]

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia: Blue Screen of Death":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Screen_of_Death]

title: despair
body:
Crushing sorrow, broken spirit, the feeling that all hope is lost. For characters that display emotional turmoil much greater than simple [[sad|sadness]].

Not to be confused with [[traumatized|traumatization]], [[humiliation]], [[shame]], or [[embarrassed|embarrassment]]. Keep in mind that including over-simplified "chibi" expressions such as "-A-" might dilute the meaning of the tag.

title: annoyed
body:
Mild anger, often caused by another's repeated troublesome actions. Annoyed characters will often appear tired or exasperated from having to endure another's antics and may show a [[squiggle]].

Distinct from [[angry|anger]] and [[furious|fury]]; use this tag when the level of frustration a character is experiencing is relatively minor.

h4. See also

* [[Angry]]
* [[Anger vein]]
* [[Excalibur face]]
* [[Furious]]
* [[Disgust]]
* [[Glaring]]
* [[Frown]]
* [[Pout]]
* [[Squiggle]]
** [[Spoken squiggle]]
* [[V-shaped eyebrows]]
* [[Tag Group:Face tags]]

title: conquest_(invincible)
body:
[[Invincible (series)|]] character.

[b]Conquest[/b] is a savage, brutal Viltrumite warrior who, true to his name, enjoys crushing his enemies and bringing entire planets to their knees. Considered brutal even by Viltrumite standards, he has become an outcast amongst his people, who only see him as a tool for destroying rebellious worlds.

Conquest is a broad, [[muscular]] Viltrumite who wears the traditional grey and white Viltrumite uniform. He has [[grey hair]] and a [[mustache]], while possessing a [[scar]] over his right eye and a [[prosthetic arm|prosthetic]] right arm.

title: boc'z_(umamusume)
body:
Five-person vocal group and unit in [[Umamusume]] originally debuting on April Fools' 2023 with a music video ([i]"Hat on Your Head!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BzRmdQioIQU][/i]) and a mock website listing the group's manifesto with personalized bios for each unit member as though they were a real-life music group.

BoC'z is a wordplay that can be read as "boushis" in Japanese (literally "The Hats"). Its members are all hat-wearing umamusume and consist of the following:

* [[Matikane Tannhauser (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|816-n]] ([[Matikane Tannhauser (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Rice Shower (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|ORYZA]] ([[Rice Shower (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Mr. C.B. (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|CAP.B]] ([[Mr. C.B. (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Hokko Tarumae (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|MACOtMai]] ([[Hokko Tarumae (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Cheval Grand (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|MARINE.C]] ([[Cheval Grand (Umamusume)|]])

For 5th Event -YELL-, the rest of the [[V Sisters]] were added to the formation:
* QueenV ([[Verxina (Umamusume)|]])
* Lil♡V ([[Vivlos (Umamusume)|]])

For April Fools' 2025, three new groups take their places with some old and new faces, collectively called [b]BoC'z we\n[/b]. They consist of the following:

* The [[beanie]]-wearing [b]AM-i[/b], consisting of:
** [[nakayama festa (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Ata Mahane]] ([[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]])
** [[rice shower (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Oryza]] (Rice Shower)

* The [[bucket hat]]-wearing [b]OK→U[/b] (read "OK for you"), consisting of:
** [[north flight (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|F-Style]] ([[North Flight (umamusume)|]])
** [[loves only you (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|<3]] ([[Loves Only You (umamusume)|]], read "Love")

* The [[baseball cap]]-wearing [b]CΛ²[/b], consisting of all of the V Sisters:
** [[verxina (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Queen V]] (Verxina)
** [[cheval grand (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Marine.C]] (Cheval Grand)
** [[vivlos (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Lil♡V]] (Vivlos)

[tn](For each version of BoC'z, Pseudonyms were stylized as above with spaces and capitalization exactly as written.)[/tn]

h4. See also

* [[UMA STARS (Umamusume)]] (April Fools 2024)

title: bodystocking
body:
A bodystocking is similar to a bodysuit, but usually made of sheer material or soft fabric, while a normal [[bodysuit]] is more rigid and thick. Think of it as a full-body [[pantyhose]], and/or a hybrid of [[pantyhose]] and [[bodysuit]].

[[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]], [[Ganyu (Genshin Impact)|]] and [[Isolated Island Oni]] are examples of characters who wear bodystockings.

h4. Examples

* !post #2620371: [[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]]
* !post #4296018: [[Ganyu (Genshin Impact)|]]
* !post #1680857: [[Isolated Island Oni]]

title: oleg_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Russian cruiser [i]Oleg[/i]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] top, [[black panties|black]] [[highleg panties]], [[black pantyhose]], [[off shoulder]] [[white coat|white]] [[fur-trimmed coat]], and [[goggles on head|goggles]] on her head. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two mechanical hull pieces, one of which contains her two twin 152 mm gun mounts.

title: chiemon_(fate)
body:

title: siris_(infinity_blade)
body:
Siris is the main protagonist of the [[Infinity Blade]] series. He is the last and greatest in a long line of fathers and sons honoring the Tradition of the Sacrifice. Siris was raised as a warrior in his hometown of Drem's Maw until he matured, at which time he was sent to face the God King in ritual combat like his ancestors before him.


https://infinityblade.fandom.com/wiki/Siris

title: four_beasts_(nikke)
body:
A group in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. The group consists of [[Behemoth (nikke)|]], [[Leviathan (nikke)|]], [[Ziz (nikke)|]], and Bahamut.

A subgroup of [[Heretics (nikke)|]] that follows a different agenda from their kin though they aren't aligned with mankind by any means. They seek to find the means to achieve their vengeance against the Offsprings who look down on, dismiss, or ignore them.; They are all named after primeval chaos-monsters from biblical texts.
other_names: フォービースト(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: behemoth_(nikke)
body:
An NPC from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A heretic and member of [[Four Beasts (nikke)|the Four Beasts]] along with [[Leviathan (nikke)|]], [[Ziz (nikke)|]], and Bahamut.

Unlike the other heretics, Behemoth is surprisingly friendly. That doesn't make her any less of a threat, though.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], and [[medium breasts]]. She has [[red eyes]], [[Black lips|black]] [[Lipstick]], [[Black Eyeliner]], and [[sharp teeth]], and two [[horns]] on one side of her head. She also have [[Black nails|black]] [[nail polish]], [[finger tattoo|finger tattoos]] [[ring|rings]], and [[spiked ear piercing|spiked ear piercings]]. She also use dark matter to make her outfit that consists of a two-piece [[black bodysuit]] that exposes her [[navel]] and [[pubic tattoo]].
other_names: ベヒーモス(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: king_hassan_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The Old Man of the Mountain, and founder of the Hassan-i-Sabbah sect of assassins. His identity and existence are obscure even to his followers; the only proof he exists is when he executes a Hassan for straying from the intended path, along with any witnesses who see him.

Appears as a tall man in a jet black [[full armor]] with [[horns|horned]] [[skull mask]].

Named [b]First Hassan[/b] in the English version. Humorously, his voice actor is [[Nakata Jouji]], who also voices [[Kotomine Kirei]] (and once had a Hassan as his Servant).

He is usually depicted as a strict moral guardian who adheres by his own code of honor, and often cannot tolerate seeing any woman wearing [[revealing clothes]], though is generally very kind to those he deemed good or innocent, especially children.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ryota-H]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Nakata Jouji]]

title: sei_shounagon_(fate)
body:
An Archer-class servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Imijikarishi Valentine]] event.

An author, poet and court lady to Empress Fujiwara no Teishi. Shounagon authored "The Pillow Book":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pillow_Book, a book of observations and personal musings she had during her service to the Empress.

Initially introduced herself as Kirakira no Archer, "The Sparkling Archer". She later refers to herself with her informal name Nagiko. She is a contemporary and rival of [[Murasaki Shikibu (fate)|]].

A notable [[otaku]] who tried to be as youthful and "in-touch" with modern culture as possible. Which were shown by her Noble Phantasm [[Emotional Engine - Full Drive]], which features a [[double v]], as well as her (in)famous [[dab (dance)|dabbing]] attack pose.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Mika Pikazo]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Fairouz Ai]]

title: head_only
body:
Character's head on its own, without a body. A neck and shoulders count as a body, if the shoulders are visible use [[cropped shoulders]] instead, if the neck is visible but shoulders are not, use [[cropped head]] instead.

Can be used when multiple heads or [[chibi]] ([[chibi inset|inset]]) are present.

[b]Do not use[/b] this tag for images where a (headless) body is present or as the  aftermath of decapitation, whether the body actually belongs to the head or not. In such cases, use [[severed head]] instead. 

h4. Examples

* !post #8943536
* !post #8940034

h4. Non-examples

* !post #9065258: [[Cropped shoulders]]. Visible shoulders
* !post #7751198: [[Cropped head]]. Visible neck and collarbone but no shoulders

h4. See also

title: hammer_and_sickle
body:
[b]The [[hammer]] and [[sickle]][/b] is a part of communist symbolism and its usage indicates an association with [[Communism]], a Communist party, or a Communist state. It symbolizes the unity of peasants and workers.

Although it is a universal symbol for communism, it is typically associated with the [[Soviet]] Union due to being the first country that adopted the symbol.

Nowadays the usage of the Hammer and Sickle has been banned in certain Nations, only the use of it is allowed in arts.

This tag is for the original hammer and sickle symbol, for various derivative or a parody of the symbol such as the [[pravda (emblem)|]] emblem, use their respective tags instead.

h4. See also

* [[Soviet flag]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hammer and sickle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hammer_and_sickle

body:
An ornate [[staff]] often carried by [[magic]] users, and used as focusing implement for [[casting spell]]s. Often decorated with [[gem]]s, [[crystal]]s and metal bands; or is carved from gnarled wood with knobbly/curly projections at the end. Sometimes both.

Not to be confused with a [[wand]], [[scepter]] or [[crosier]].

body:
A [[Twitter]] [[meme]] featuring rabbit ears attached to the image from the caption.

[quote][code]
⠀⢀⡤⣄⡀
⢠⡏⠀⠀⠳⡄⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣀⣀⣀
⢸⠃⠀⠀⠀⢿⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣼⠃⠀⠘⢧
⢸⡆⠀⠀⠀⠸⡆⠀⠀⠀⣸⠃⠀⠀⠀⠈⢧
⠈⣇⠀⠀⠀⠀⣧⠀⠀⠀⡏⠀⢦⠀⠀⠀⠸⡆
⠀⠀⢹⡀⠀⠀⢸⠀⠀⢸⠇⠀⠘⢧⡀⠀⣸⠃
⠀⠀⠀⢳⠀⠀⢸⡆⠀⢸⠀⠀⠀⣼⠙⠋⠁
[/code][/quote]

Usually, a character's head is cropped towards the top left of the image, since Twitter displays captions above images. This effect currently does not display correctly on Danbooru.

title: zaku_ii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. Notable because it has the distinction of being the [b]first robot[/b] featured during the begining of the entire franchise.

[b]MS-06 Zaku II[/b]

The main combat [[mobile suit]] of the Principality of [[Zeon]] during the One Year War. Originating from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] as the [[Zaku II F/J]], there have been several variations of this mobile suit. Characterized by its domed head, [[shoulder_spikes|spiked shoulder]], [[one-eyed|one eye]]/head-mounted camera, and (typical) dark green color. 

This tag refers to specific group of mecha found in the gundam universe's One Year War setting and should not be used as a character tag.

title: gundam_mk_ii
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RX-178 Gundam Mk. II[/b]

A revised and much improved design of the original [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. While in testing under the [[Titans_(gundam)|]], the sinister looking dark blue colored prototypes were stolen by [[Quattro Bajeena]] and the [[AEUG]] with the help of [[Kamille Bidan]], who went on to pilot the sole surviving unit before switching to his own designed mobile suit, [[Zeta Gundam_(mobile_suit)|]]. The unit was later repainted white while at the service of the AEUG (to evoke the iconic look of the legendary original Gundam).

It was later piloted by [[Emma Sheen]] during the Gryps Conflict, and various different members of the [[Gundam Team]] during the events of [[Gundam ZZ]], more prominently [[Elle Vianno]].

h4. See also
* [[Super Gundam]]
* [[G-Defenser]]
* [[Gundam Mk II Banagher Links Custom]]

title: europa_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first seen during the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Europa is one of [[Zeus (fate)|]]' consorts, and the mother of King Minos (whose wife mated with the Cretan bull and gave birth to [[Asterios (fate)|]]). Zeus was so enamored by Europa that he transformed himself into a tame white [[bull]] and managed to abduct her to Crete, where she became queen. The [[robot animal|robotic]] bull she rides into battle is not Zeus himself, but rather a look-alike based on his appearance as a bull.

[spoiler]In the [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt, remnants of Zeus' wife [[Hera (mythology)|]] becomes fused with Europa in order to prevent her death. Since Zeus wasn't as considerate as his proper human history counterpart, Europa chooses to defect from him and assist [[Novum Chaldea]] in defeating him.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[redjuice]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ichimichi Mao]]

title: zaku_machinery
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Walpurgis]].

[b]MS-11R Zaku Machinery[/b]

A newly-constructed modernized variant of the [[Act Zaku]] MS developed by [[Neo Zeon]] in U.C. 0089. 

Although it seems simplistic in comparison to other [[mobile_suit|MS]] units of the same era, it is remarkably versatile with high standards in terms of basic performance similar to the future [[Geara Doga]].

title: zaku_machinery_ernardo_custom
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Walpurgis]].

[b]MS-11RS Zaku Machinery Ernardo Custom[/b]

A high performance officer variant of the [[Zaku Machinery]] [[mobile suit]] developed for [[Ernardo Bat]]. 

It is covered in advanced gold colored beam resistant coating (like the [[Hyaku Shiki]]) and is armed with a long distance [[beam rifle]].

title: frankenstein
body:
A novel written by Mary Shelley. It tells the story of a man named Victor Frankenstein, who wanted to create life from dead tissue.

The novel has been adapted to film multiple times, most notably in 1931 by Universal Pictures, from where many depictions of [[Frankenstein's monster]] come.

She resides in the "Ring of the Lady of the Plains", which was entrusted to the royal family of Elusia.

title: lyn_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]], and one of the three Lords of the game along with [[Eliwood (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Hector (Fire Emblem)|]].

Full name Lyndis, a Sacaean swordswoman, her own quest comprises the tutorial mode of the game, and has her claim her birthright as a Lycian noble. She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[green hair]] usually in a [[ponytail]]. [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] also tends to portray her as being [[large_breasts|large-chested]].

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 1 of the 2017's edition of Choose Your Legends (Fire Emblem Heroes' popularity poll), making her the first overall winner of CYL.

Voiced by [[Oomoto Makiko]] in Japanese and [[Wendee Lee]] in English.

body:

Due to being summoned without [[Artemis (fate)|]]'s interference, he appears as a [[muscular male|muscular]] human instead of a [[teddy bear]]. title: artemis_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], along with her bear partner [[orion (bear) (fate)|Orion]]. The depiction of the [[Artemis (mythology)|Greek goddess of the moon and hunting]] of the same name.

Unlike the other divine servants, Artemis manifested in her true form without the need of a vessel body, primarily due to her interference with Orion's saint graph. Because of this, she is summoned as "Orion" while reducing the true Orion into a miniature bear companion. She claimed to do so to "watch over" him.

She first appeared in the event [[Tsuki no Megami wa Odango no Yume wo Miru ka?]] before appearing in the [[Okeanos (fate/grand order)|]] singularity.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[I-IV (longman)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]

title: thigh_strap
body:
A strap worn around the [[thighs|thigh]]. A thigh strap may be a band of fabric or leather, or a belt, but not metal.

Not to be confused with a [[thighlet]], which is a band of metal.

Sometimes connect to a [[single garter strap]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7583741: [[Thigh belt]]

title: miku_collar_bikini
body:
A drawing trend based on either [[maud0239]] or [[channel (caststation)|]]'s drawing of [[Hatsune Miku]] in a striped bikini but with her collar, [[necktie]], and [[detached sleeves]] still worn as well.

Channel's drawing has Miku wearing a very [[crop top|cropped]] version of her white shirt with a [[micro bikini]]. Maud's version has her wear only the [[detached_collar|collar]] of her grey shirt, as well as [[Kagamine Rin]] likewise wearing only the [[sailor collar]], [[neckerchief]], and [[arm warmers]] of her own outfit.

Channel's art was posted in November 2023, months earlier before the trend began. But after Maud posted their art in June 2024, Channel "replied":[https://twitter.com/_CASTSTATION/status/1797961117282828612] to it with a repost of their own version, saying they wanted this kind of Miku to start trending, and thus it did.

* !post #6908324: [[channel (caststation)|]]'s version
* !post #7670286: [[maud0239]]'s version

title: paw_pose
body:
A hand pose imitating [[paws]].
Stereotypically arms in front ; elbows bent up; hands close to chest (sometimes face), palm outward and closed in loose.

Often with the onomatopoeia [[nyan]] (にゃん) near, in imitation of a cat's meow.

h4. Example
* !post #3801607

h4. Not to be confused with

* [[claw pose]] (fingers curled)
* [[ghost pose]] (hands limp)
* [[zombie pose]] (arms straight, hands limp)

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Gestures]]

title: shota
body:
[[howto:rate|Sexually explicit]] or [[sexually suggestive]] artwork of boys who appear to be preadolescent (roughly between the age of 3 to 12). It's a purely visual tag, so the character's canonical age doesn't matter.

Work-safe, non-sexual artwork of young boys should not be tagged as [[shota]]. Use [[child]] or [[age difference]] instead. If you are not sure whether a post should be tagged as shota, ask in the "loli / shota check thread":[/forum_topics/8650].

This is a [[help:censored tags|censored tag]], which requires a "Gold+ Account":/user_upgrades/new to view.

h4. See also

For pictures about the [i]concept[/i] of shotacon, see the tag [[pedophile]].

title: revy_(black_lagoon)
body:
[b]Revy[/b] is the female lead of [[Black Lagoon]] and the Lagoon Company's primary muscle. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[black tank top]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[denim shorts|denim]] [[micro shorts]].

Known as "Two Hand" because of her penchant for [[dual wielding]] guns, she is the member of the company most likely to use violence to deal with problems and is very nihilistic and cynical, which often puts her at odds with the more idealistic [[Okajima Rokuro|Rock]]. Revy enjoys a good gunfight, and works with [[dutch_(black_lagoon)|Dutch]] because she gets to shoot people and get paid, though her violent tendencies often border on the psychotic at times. Her full name is Rebecca Lee.

title: otoko_no_ko
body:
A male character who looks female.

The Japanese term 男の娘 ([i]otoko no ko[/i]) is a pun on 男の子 ([i]otoko no ko[/i]), meaning "boy", replacing 子 with the [i]ko[/i] reading of 娘 (commonly [i]musume[/i], girl).

Across English-speaking communities, these characters are referred to in a number of different ways with no single standard term. The most common are "trap" and "femboy", and less frequently "tomgirl" or "otokonoko" are used.

Some people use "femboy" to describe anyone who appears or acts feminine, even if they don't convincingly pass as female. If you can correctly tell the character is male with complete certainty from the thumbnail alone without looking at the genitalia, it's not this.

While many otoko no ko engage in [[crossdressing]], it is not a requirement. Sufficiently feminine characters can pass as girls even when near-nude or dressed in typically masculine clothing.

h4. Examples

* !post #7072773
* !post #6200714
* !post #6422497

h4. Notable characters

* [[Ansel (arknights)|]] and [[Mizuki (arknights)|]] from [[Arknights]]
* [[Arikawa Hime]] from [[Himegoto]]
* [[Astolfo (fate)|]] from [[Fate/Apocrypha]]
* [[Bill (black souls)|]] and [[Serpent God (black souls)|]] from [[Black Souls]]
* [[Bridget (guilty gear)|]] from [[Guilty Gear]]
* [[Felix Argyle]] from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu|Re:Zero]]
* [[Forrest (fire emblem)|]] and [[Rosado (fire emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]]
* [[Fujisaki Chihiro]] from [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc]]
* [[Haku (naruto)|]] from [[Naruto]]
* [[Honjou Kamatari]] from [[Rurouni Kenshin]]
* [[Kanzaki Hideri]] from [[Blend S]]
* [[Kikunojo (one_piece)|]] from [[One Piece]]
* [[Kinoshita Hideyoshi]] from [[Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu]]
* [[Midare Toushirou]] from [[Touken Ranbu]]
* [[Shidou Mariya]] from [[Maria Holic]]
* [[Totsuka Saika]] from [[Yahari ore no seishun lovecome wa machigatteiru.]]
* [[Urushibara Ruka]] from [[Steins;Gate]]
* [[Watarase Jun]] from [[Happiness!]]
* [[Yuuki Kei]] from [[Moyashimon]]

h4. See also 

* [[bishounen]] for boys with both masculine and feminine beauty traits
* [[reverse trap]] for ladies in masculine dress
* [[girly boy]] for boys that are feminine in personality, but not necessarily appearance
* [[futa without pussy]] for male genitalia, but otherwise female body
* [[cuntboy]] for female genitalia, but otherwise male body
* [[futanari]] for those with both male and female genitals, but female body
* [[josou seme]], Otoko no ko being the more dominant sexual partner
* "Pool: Manly Femboys":[/pools/18464]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Otokonoko":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otokonoko

title: florence_nightingale_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] featured in the [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. The eponymous "Angel of Crimea", a British nurse from the Victorian era best known for her contribution to the modern medical study and effort to improve the conditions in hospitals.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] light [[pink hair]] worn in a [[braided ponytail]]. She wears a red [[military uniform]] with a [[black skirt]]. In her third Ascension level, she has a [[bandage over one eye]] and a [[black coat]] worn [[coat on shoulders|over her shoulders]].

Nightingale usually behaves in a cold and stoic manner. Due to the side effect of Madness Enchantment from her classification, she has an obsession with keeping anything clean or sanitized, and also causing her will to treat someone to go overboard, to the point that she will do anything to treat her patient, such as killing anyone who interrupts her treatment process.

She uses a [[pepperbox revolver]] in combat in addition to other unconventional weapons, such as throwing [[bed]]s.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takahashi Keitarou]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]

title: aisha_(last_origin)
body:
AKA GM Aisha, SmartJoy's Last Origin Community Manager and Game Master (GM). Since GM Aisha is intimately involved with the community, she is usually the one that receives the full brunt of hate and complaints from the community whenever SJ mess up. Be it with unpopular move/choice or just general spaghetti code madness. As such, it is common to see the character apologising.

The character comes in 3 flavours; a tired looking senior with polka dot panties AKA Aisha (Leader), a naive newbie who wears ribbon panties and has small spike at the end of her eyelashes AKA Aisha 48, and a fresh newbie who wears striped panties, has cat curvature on her top lip, and has a small spike in the middle of her eyelashes AKA Aisha 81.

Aisha is stronger than GM Orangeaid but is getting weaker every day.
other_names: アイシャ(ラストオリジン)

title: denkou_choujin_gridman:_boys_invent_great_hero
body:
[b]Denkou Choujin Gridman: boys invent great hero[/b] is the ninth short featured in the [[Japan Animator Expo]]. It is based off of the live action series [[Denkou Choujin Gridman]].

The entire short took place 22 years after Gridman's final battle with [[Kahn Digifier]]. [[Toudou Takeshi]], a former brainwashed servant of Kahn, reflects on the past incidents as monster attacks took place in real life. Using the Acceptor, he transforms into [[Gridman Sigma]] before facing the monster.

title: gridman_sigma
body:
Gridman Sigma was the proposed ally of [[Gridman (character)|]] in a sequel series that was never completed or even aired. Sigma would have become the alter ego of [[Toudou Takeshi]], a reformed antagonist of the original series. Sigma would have fought a relative of [[Kahn Digifier]].

In 2015, Gridman Sigma made his first public appearance in the anime short, [[Denkou Choujin Gridman: boys invent great hero]] where he is finally partnered with Toudou Takeshi.

title: gyaruo
body:
The male counterpart to [[gyaru]]. While the term originated from the styles reported on by fashion magazine [i]Men's Egg[/i], it has since gone on to become a moniker for the youth subculture that wore it.

Like their female counterparts, typical gyaruo attire comes in different flavors. The most common depictions have [[tan]]s or [[dark skin]], [[blonde hair]] with or without an [[undercut]], or some sort of loose fashion. However, not everyone who is tan or blond may be part of the gyaruo subculture.

Also spelled as "gyaru-oh" or "gal-o":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1EKTw50Uf8M] alternately. Due to their flashiness, 2010s japanese youth tend to associate them with the term "charao" (チャラ男).

As with their female counterpart, gyaruo were similary depicted as either an extroverted and often hot-headed douchebag in mainstream, or being a hypersexual who hits on many different women in erotic works.

An [[otoko no ko]] who dresses up as a [[gyaru]] does not count as a gyaruo.

h4. Examples

* !post #5191916
* !post #9158423

title: diarmuid_ua_duibhne_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Zero]] character.

A slim young man with [[yellow eyes]], [[black hair]] combed back, (with a single lock that falls on his forehead), and a distinctive [[mole]]. Wears a tight fitting sleeveless [[blue shirt]], a brown leather [[belt]] and black [[detached sleeves]]. Wields two [[spear]]s, [[Gae Dearg (fate)|]] and [[Gae Buidhe (fate)|]].

Not to be confused with [[Cu Chulainn (fate/stay night)|Lancer (Fate/stay night)]].

[b]True Name:[/b] Diarmuid Ua Duibhne
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]

title: tamamo_no_mae_(fate/extra)
body:
Selectable Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Extra]] and [[Fate/Extra CCC]]. Also one of the Servants of Chaldea in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The "core" (i.e main body) of the "[[Tamamo (fate)|]] nine" servants who were split from [[Amaterasu (fate)|]].

She's a magical [[fox girl]] who uses a [[mirror]] as her [[weapon]], has [[pink hair]], [[yellow eyes]], dressed in stylized traditional blue [[japanese clothes|japanese robes]], often has [[split ponytail]] hairstyle with [[blue bow]]. 
Her theme name is "Caster: Extra Life With Whoever She Wants".

title: hassan_of_the_cursed_arm_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. He appears in [[Fate/stay night]], where he is known as [b]True Assassin[/b], and in [[Fate/Grand Order]], where is he known as [b]Hassan of the Cursed Arm[/b].

His appearance is that of a slender, dark man with a [[skull mask]] and his oversized right arm wrapped in [[bandages]].

In [[Fate/stay night]], he appears in the [[Heaven's Feel]] route as the Servant of [[Matou Zouken]].

title: sasaki_kojirou_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. An Assassin-class Servant who appears in [[Fate/stay night]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]]. He is often seen wearing [[Japanese clothes]] and wielding a [[sword]].

In [[Fate/stay night]], he is a Servant summoned by [[Medea (caster) (fate)|]], another Servant, which is normally against the rules of the Holy Grail War. This makes him weaker than a normal Servant and dependent on Caster for mana. In the [[Heaven's Feel]] route, he is killed and his body is used to summon [[Hassan of the Cursed Arm (Fate)|]], the True Assassin.

title: medea_(caster)_(fate)
body:
A character from [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], with a [[side braid]] tied behind her left ear. She also has [[pointy ears]].

She is often seen wearing a black [[hood]]ed [[robe]] over a [[purple dress]] while wielding a [[staff]]. Her Noble Phantasm is [[Rule breaker (fate)|]], a [[knife]] with a zig-zagging blade that destroys magical contracts. In [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], she’s wearing her [[medea (casual) (Fate)|casual outfit]], which is a [[denim jacket]] over a [[black shirt]] and [[long skirt]].

[[Circe (fate)|]] is her aunt.

title: gilgamesh_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|]] character who appears in [[Fate/zero]], [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/strange Fake]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. 

The heroic spirit of the legendary Sumerian king. Identifying as a demigod and the 'King of Heroes,' he possesses the appearance of a [[blonde hair|blonde]], [[red eyes|red-eyed]] man in [[gold armor|golden]] [[armor]]. Some appearances depict him without his armor, revealing his [[toned]] body.

He is originally summoned by [[Tohsaka Tokiomi]] during the Fuyuki Grail Wars in [[Fate/Zero]]. Following his death, he formed a contract with [[Kotomine Kirei]], who helped him take measures allowing him to survive into the Fifth Grail War in [[Fate/stay night]]. While the Fuyuki Grail summons him into the Archer class, his existence in [[Fate/extra CCC]] is unable to be constrained by class.

In [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], he takes a magic potion to become a younger version of himself, known as [[Child Gilgamesh (fate)|]], while in [[Fate/strange Fake]], he is the "False" Archer-class Servant of [[Tine Chelc]].

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], he becomes an ally and playable Servant as the Wise King of Uruk under the [[Gilgamesh (Caster) (Fate)|]] designation.

Notable for his arrogant and narcissistic personality, with him calling almost any other non-Sumerians or gods as "mongrel" (雑種 - [i]zasshu[/i]). He is enamored by [[Saber (fate)|]] for her beauty and noble spirit, her continual refusal of him only compounding his obsessive desire.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Seki Tomokazu]]

title: altera_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. The main character of [[Fate/Extella]] and a summonable Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She is a Saber-class Servant, carrying the historical name of Attila the Hun. A character of unknown origin or backstory, found by the Huns in mysterious Saharan ruins, crowned as their King of Destruction and eventually deified as the Scourge of God. She wields the sword [[Photon Ray (fate)|]].

title: heracles_(fate)
body:
The Berserker-class Servant of [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]] in [[Fate/stay night]]. Also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

For the [[Fate/Zero]] character, see [[Berserker (Fate/Zero)]].

A [[tall male|colossus]] (over 8 feet) of [[muscular male|muscle]], with [[dark skin|brown skin]], [[glowing eyes]] (one golden, one red) and long wild [[black hair]]. Wears only [[bracelet]]s and an armored kilt, and wields a chipped stone greatsword. Often seen with his Master Illyasviel von Einzbern, who prefers to sit on his shoulder.

[b]True Name:[/b] [[Heracles (mythology)|]], the strongest hero in [[Greek Mythology]]
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]

title: kimi_to_idol_precure
body:
The twenty-second installment of the [[Precure]] franchise, released in 2025. Both [i]Kimi to Idol[/i] and its subtitle [i]You and Idol[/i] both mean the same thing, so the Japanese portion is used here.

h4.Synopsis

I'm Sakura Uta, a second year student who loves to sing!

One day, while walking my dog, Kyu-chan, I was taken by surprise! A big peach-like thing came floating down the river, where I met the cute talking fairy, Purirun!
Purirun has come to search for the Legendary Protectors "Idol Pretty Cure"! Purirun's hometown, KirakiLand was a peaceful place full of sparkles, but it has been plunged into total darkness by Darkine, the boss of the Chokkiri Gang.
So together with Purirun, I decided to search for the Idol Pretty Cure who can illuminate the darkness with light! Maybe it should be the type of person who's bright and happy!
But then the Chokkiri Gang appears in Hanamichi Town, and steals the sparkles of the townspeople... it's a huge pinch!

"I want to make it sparkle! With my song!"

The moment I made that decision, the Pretty Cure Ribbon and Idol Heart Brooch appeared, and I transformed into the Legendary Protector, Cure Idol!

Singing, dancing, and fan service♡
I'm going to make it sparkle no matter what!
The stage between you and me is about to begin!


h4.Characters

* [[Sakura Uta (precure)|]] / [[Cure Idol]]
* [[Aokaze Nana]] / [[Cure Wink]]
* [[Shigure Kokoro]] / [[Cure Kyunkyun]]

title: lolita_fashion
body:
A Japanese fashion style influenced by [[Victorian]] children's clothing as well as costumes from the [[Rococo movement]].

The fashion consists primarily of a knee length [[skirt]] or [[dress]], [[headdress]], [[blouse]], [[petticoat]]/[[crinoline]], [[kneehighs|knee length socks]] or [[thighhighs|stockings]] and rocking horse or [[high heels|high heel]]/[[platform shoes]]. [[Teddy bear]]s and [[doll]]s are often carried to emphasize the childlike look. 

Please note that [[Lolita fashion]] and [[loli]] are two very different things. [[mature female|Older women]] can be shown wearing these clothes as well.

h4. Substyles

title: mountain_tim
body:
Mountain Tim is a secondary ally featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].
He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user and is able to shift through his [[lasso]] with his ability, [[Oh! Lonesome Me (stand)|]].
Mountain Tim is a man of average to above-average height, average build and has light hair. He later acquires a [[scar]] crossing his face.

He wears a stereotypical range of cowboy attire; his hat has a [[zebra print]] with a miniature [[cow skull|cow's skull]] as a decoration, while the clothing on his upper torso is coated with a [[leopard print]], his [[belt]] gun [[holster]], and his [[scarf]] has a [[leopard print]]. He wears a sheriff's badge in the shape of a five-pointed [[star]] on his left side.

title: finger_heart
body:
A popular hand gesture among [[k-pop]] idols used as a more subtle substitute for [[heart hands]]. The index finger typically crosses the thumb in a v pattern, forming a heart-like shape where the two fingers meet. Only one hand is used for this gesture; if two hands are used then it is likely [[heart hands]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #4405765
* !post #4777049

title: four-finger_heart_hands
body:
[[Heart hands]] made with only four fingers.

The heart is usually made with the thumb and index fingers or the index and middle fingers.

The remaining six fingers are most often fully stretched or clenched, but there are also cases where they are slightly bent. In this case, we need to consider whether the fingers are naturally bent due to our anatomy, or whether the rest of the fingers are also bent in a heart shape and are in the process of forming the original heart hand.

h4. Examples

title: winter_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] worn during [[winter]] or [[cold]]er months. Notable examples are [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black serafuku]] or [[blazer]]s worn over [[cardigan]]s.

Not to be used for military uniforms for cold climates (e.g. those with arctic camouflage).

h4.See also

title: summer_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] worn during [[summer]] or [[hot]]ter months. Notable examples are [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]]s or [[white serafuku]]. May still include a [[cardigan vest]] or [[sweater vest]].

Not to be used for military uniforms for warmer climates (e.g. desert camouflage fatigues).

title: country_lolita
body:
A more toned-down, pastoral style of [[Lolita fashion]].

It typically uses a lot of [[gingham]] patterns, [[apple]] and other [[fruit]] motifs, [[floral print]]s, [[basket]]s, [[hat]]s, and classic colors such as reds and greens. 

h4. Examples

* !post #9063101
* !post #7776469

h4. See also
 
* [[Classic Lolita]]
* [[Mori Kei]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

title: hime_lolita
body:
A substyle of [[Lolita fashion]] derived from [[Hime Gyaru]], featuring an over-the-top princessy aesthetic, often overlapping with either [[Classic Lolita]] or [[Sweet Lolita]].

Typically lighter colors are used and pieces have a significant amount of [[frills]]. [[Big hair]]styles with [[ringlets]] and curls are common, similar to Hime Gyaru. [[Crown]]s and [[tiara]]s make for common accessories, along with [[elbow gloves]], gold or silver [[jewelry]], [[rose]]s, and [[pearl]]s. Shoes are usually [[high heels]], but [[mary janes]] are worn as well.

h4. Examples

* !post #9065442
* !post #6978369

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

title: merman
body:
A mythical sea creature which has the top half of a human male and the hind half (fins) of a fish. Less commonly known and often depicted less attractive than their female counterparts, though they've been looking more human and just as pretty as their female counterparts as time goes on.

Not to be confused with [[fish boy|fishmen]], which have a humanoid hind half but more fishlike characteristics throughout their bodies.

title: kamen_rider_virgo_(game)
body:
A work of [[Kamen Rider]] fanfiction that was developed into a RPG scenario using "SRC (Simulation RPG Construction)":[http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simulation_RPG_Construction], Windows freeware created by Kei that allows user to create strategy role-playing games, by "Kishimoto Miyuki":[http://twitter.com/miyukivirgo]. Not to be confused with [[virgo zodiarts|an antagonist]] in [[Kamen Rider Fourze (series)|]].

Despite being a beta version, it was highly praised for its setting that combined the so-called Shouwa Rider and Heisei Rider settings, and its excellent production and plot. However, due to the excessive time it took for development, the scenario rapidly spun out of control as the number of heroes appearing increased leading to total chaos, and the project died out naturally before its completion when Kishimoto made his professional debut as "a scenario writer":[http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=77288]. Former fans of this game believe that Virgo lives on in the TV series supervised by Kishimoto such as [[Ben-Tou]] and [[Tales of the Abyss]] to console themselves. 

The main character of the story, Honjou Maki was one of 12 altered humans created by the evil organization ERASER, each named for one of the 12 [[zodiac]] signs, and after escaping from the organization, battled evil as "Kamen Rider Virgo" (a female Kamen Rider). The secondary protagonist, Shigure Kyousuke was the hero of the sister series "SRC Hero Club," who transforms into "Kamen Rider Otis." 

h4. External links

* [[nico nico douga|NicoVideo]]: "Kamen Rider Virgo Opening":[http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm3689088]

Has a younger twin sister, [[Euryale (fate)|]], and a younger sister, [[Medusa (rider) (fate)|Medusa]]. Depicted as a [[purple hair]]ed girl with [[purple eyes]], [[twintails]], a [[headdress]] and [[white dress]]. The difference between her sister is the black rose ornament, the slit, and arm decoration is on her left side. They appear identical in Fate/hollow ataraxia.

title: maus_(tank)
body:
The [b]Panzerkampfwagen VIII Maus[/b] ("Mouse") was a German [[World War II]] super-heavy [[tank]] prototype design completed in late 1944.

It is the heaviest fully enclosed armored fighting vehicle ever built. The complete vehicle was 10.2 metres (33 ft 6 in) long, 3.71 metres (12 ft 2 in) wide and 3.63 metres (11.9 ft) high. Weighing 188 metric tons, the Maus's main armament was the Krupp-designed 128 mm KwK 44 L/55 gun, based on the 12.8 cm Pak 44 anti-tank field artillery piece also used in the casemate-type [[Jagdtiger]] tank destroyer, with a coaxial 75 mm KwK 44 L/36.5 gun. The 128 mm gun was powerful enough to destroy all Allied armored fighting vehicles then in service, some at ranges exceeding 3,500 metres (3,800 yd).

However, the vehicle's extreme weight meant that it was ridiculously slow and impractical, being a perfect target for bombing runs by aircraft. In addition, it was a logistical nightmare, needing absurd amounts of fuel and being difficult to maintain and repair. If fielded in large numbers, it would most likely not have had any significant effect on the war effort due to its complete unsuitability for the mobile, air-dominated battlefield. Only two prototypes were constructed, the first of which did not have an actual turret. The second prototype had its hull destroyed by the Germans to prevent Russian forces from capturing it. The surviving Maus in Kublinka tank museum today is the turret from the second prototype on the hull of the first prototype.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzerkampfwagen VIII Maus":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_VIII_Maus

title: tank
body:
An armored, [[caterpillar tracks|tracked]] [[military vehicle]] with a single [[cannon]] (some tanks may have mounted [[machine gun]]s or more than one cannon). Its heavy armor protects  the crew from enemy fire while the tracks let it traverse difficult terrain or obstacles.

For tagging purposes this tag may also be used on any tank-like [[motor vehicle|vehicle]], whether real or fictional. This may include things such as tank destroyers (ex: [[Sturmgeschutz III]]), [[self-propelled artillery]] (ex: [[M109 Howitzer]]), rocket artillery, and the like.

For the container type tank, use the tag: [[tank (container)]]. Do not confuse with [[tank top]], which refers to a type of shirt.

h4. Examples

* !post #7558772: Modern Main Battle Tank (MBT) ([[M1 Abrams]])
* !post #8075834: [[Turretless Tank|Turretless]] [[Tank Destroyer]] ([[Sturmgeschutz III]])
* !post #2641172: Tracked [[Self-propelled Artillery]] ([[M109 Howitzer]])

title: turretless_tank
body:
A [[tank]] or tank-like armored [[military vehicle]] featuring a casemate (turretless) design, with the main gun mounted directly within the hull of the vehicle instead of in a rotating turret.

Advantages of such designs were that they were mechanically simpler than turreted designs, less costly to produce, lighter in weight, and lower in profile. Due to taking up less weight in the design, heavier armor and/or armaments could be added onto the chassis.  A primary disadvantage to this design was that the main weapon was affixed with a limited fire arc in the front and thus required the entire vehicle rotating to be able to target things outside this arc.

h4. Examples

* !post #1475708: [[Jagdpanther]]

h4. List of Real Life Vehicles

h6. WWII - German

* [[Jagdpanther]] (Tank Destroyer)

title: boudica_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Boudica is a famous Celtic queen who led her tribe in an ultimately failed war against the invading Romans. Despite this, she is known as the "Queen of Victory" in her homeland of the United Kingdom, an epithet that she despised.

She has [[red hair]] and [[aqua eyes]]. Her first ascension is a peculiar [[white bikini]]-esque outfit, while she would gradually gaining more clothing in each ascensions.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Aotsuki Takao]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Chiwa]]

title: edward_teach_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Also known as "Blackbeard", the most notorious pirate in history who was known for his purported ruthlessness and his brutal death. He appeared in the Third Singularity "Okeanos".

In-game, Teach is depicted as a [[pervert]] and has strong [[otaku]] vibes, visible in several quotes in the game (in which he mentions several [[Visual Novel]] tropes), his final ascension art, and as well as several memetic references.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[B suke]]
[b]Voice Actor[/b]: [[Saizen Tadahisa]]

title: karl_i/iv/iii
body:
Karl von Habsburg (August 17, 1887 - April 1, 1922) was the second and final emperor of [[Austria-Hungary]]. In addition to his Imperial title as "Charles I of [[Austria]]", he had the Royal titles of "Charles IV of [[Hungary]]" and "Charles III of [[Czech Republic|Bohemia]]". 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Charles I of Austria":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_I_of_Austria]

title: medusa_(rider)_(fate)
body:
A character from [[Fate/Stay Night]] and [[Fate/Hollow Ataraxia]]. She has [[purple eyes]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] and often wears [[glasses]] or a [[blindfold]]. 

In combat, she wears a [[black dress|black]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[short dress]], [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves]], and a [[purple collar|purple]] [[collar]] around her neck. She wields two nail-like "daggers" connected by a chain, known as the [[Nameless Dagger (fate)|]]s. Also has a [[forehead mark]].

Out of combat, she typically wears enchanted [[glasses]], and fills out a [[black sweater]] and [[jeans]] quite nicely.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Asakawa Yuu]]

title: euryale_(fate)
body:
Euryale (Greek for "Far-Flier") is a character from [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], and can be summoned as an Archer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Her Noble Phantasm is "Eye of the Euryale", a powerful single-target attack that does more damage and charms the target if it is male.

Has an older twin sister, [[Stheno (fate)|]], and a younger sister, [[Medusa (rider) (fate)|Medusa]]. Depicted as a [[purple hair]]ed girl with [[purple eyes]], [[twintails]], a [[headdress]] and [[white dress]]. The difference between her twin sister is the black rose ornament, the slit, and arm decoration is on her right side. They appear identical in Fate/hollow ataraxia.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Akira (kaned fools)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Asakawa Yuu]]

title: romulus_(fate)
body:
The 3-star Lancer version of the Nation-Building Hero who founded Rome in ancient times. All Roman Servants look up to him for inspiration. Has a penchant for shouting, "ROME!" all the time, as well as standing in a Y pose for his battle animation.

For the 5-star version of him, see [[romulus quirinus (fate)|Romulus Quirinus]].

title: pinky_out
body:
"When in doubt, pinky out."

A habit of etiquette when drinking from a teacup, where the 'pinky' finger is extended while the others are retracted. May be applied to other situations. Also known as "pinky up".

[[Iseri Nina]] is known for extending her pinky as a substitute of a [[middle finger]].

h4. See also

* [[pinky swear]]

title: big_sister_(bioshock)
body: In [[BioShock 2]], the Big Sisters are post-pubescent [[Little Sister (bioshock)|]]s that have become unstable in Rapture's environment. Ten years after the events of [[bioshock (series)|BioShock]], they are charged with maintaining the ecological balance in Rapture. The Big Sisters' designs are geared towards accommodating Little Sisters; they have a cage-like basket that is adorned with ribbons, which is used to safely carry Little Sisters on their backs, and childish doodles can be seen on their oxygen tanks.

title: severa_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Severa[/b] is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. 

She is the future daughter of [[cordelia (fire emblem)|Cordelia]]. Stuck under her mother's shadow for most of her life, she desired to become her own person unattached to her mother's legacy. Abrasive to a fault, but somewhat softens up. Has highly [[tsundere]] tendencies.

Voiced by Seto Saori in the Japanese version and [[Julie Ann Taylor]] in the English version (who also voices her mother Cordelia in that version.)

h4. Appearance

* !post #6952044
* !post #4419085: [[severa (spring) (fire emblem)|Spring]]

h4. See also

* [[Selena (Fire Emblem Fates)|]] - her appearance in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]
other_names: セレナ(ファイアーエムブレム)

title: selena_(fire_emblem_fates)
body:
[b]Selena[/b] (ルーナ, [i]Luna[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

[[Camilla (fire emblem)|]]'s subordinate. A sore loser. Even if she's not the best at everything, in her mind she is, and has made great efforts to live up to her potential. She lets her guard down and is surprisingly kind to her female friends.

She is an alternate version of [spoiler][[Severa (Fire Emblem)|]] crossed over from a different dimension, along with [[Laslow (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Odin (Fire Emblem)|]].[/spoiler]

She is voiced by Seto Saori in the Japanese version and [[Julie Ann Taylor]] in the English version.

Not to be confused with the [[Selena (Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones)|character of the same name]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Mercenary

h4. Appearance

* !post #2621835

title: mochtroid
body:
Failed clones of [[Metroid (creature)|]]s, significantly weaker and barely able to latch on to their prey. They are first seen in [[Super Metroid]], as holograms in the demo release of [[Metroid Prime Hunters]], and in [[Metroid Prime 4: Beyond]].

Physically they share almost every trait a standard Metroid does, but have only one nucleus instead of the usual four.

title: metroid_larva
body:
A [[metroid (creature)|]] in its infancy. This is the most common form ever seen, as they require highly specific environmental conditions to evolve properly.

Larvae are shaped like green jellyfish with four red nuclei inside their dome, and two sets of fangs to grip its prey with on their underbelly. They float through the air with ease, and can carry and push things roughly their size or slightly larger. By latching onto prey and draining the life force from it, the prey disintegrates into dust if the lifeless husk is disturbed after feeding.

Not to be confused with [[mochtroid]]s, which are failed clones of metroids- visually distinguishable by only one nucleus.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25600120

title: metal_luigi
body:
[[Luigi]] becoming completely covered in metal sheen, making him heavier and more difficult to KO, debuting in [i][[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Melee]][/i].

Unlike [[Mario]] or [[Wario]] he does not naturally have this ability in [[Super Mario 64]] or [[Super Mario 64 DS]], respectively.

title: bee_luigi
body: [[Luigi]] wearing a [[bee costume]] that gives him the ability to fly and climb up honeycomb walls when using the [[Bee Mushroom]], debuting in [i][[Super Mario Galaxy]][/i].

title: boo_luigi
body: [[Luigi]] transformed into an [[Boo (mario)|]] when using the [[Boo Mushroom]], allowing him to phase through bars and turn invisible temporarily. Debuted in [i][[Super Mario Galaxy]][/i].

title: shell_luigi
body: [[Luigi]] wearing a blue koopa shell, which allows him to retract into the shell sliding, bouncing off walls and defeating most enemies in his path. it also allows him to swim faster. Debuted in [i][[New Super Mario Bros.]][/i]

title: propeller_luigi
body: [[Luigi]] wearing a [[flight suit]] and a [[helmet]] with a [[propeller]] attached. This gives them the ability to propel upwards at great heights and safely slowly descend in the air  when using the [[Propeller Mushroom]], debuting in [i][[New Super Mario Bros. Wii]][/i].

title: raccoon_luigi
body: [[Luigi]] wearing [[raccoon ears]] and a [[raccoon tail]] that gives him the ability to attack with his tail and safely slowly descend in the air when using the [[Super Leaf]], debuting in [i][[Super Mario Bros. 3]][/i].

title: evertsen_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the destroyer HNLMS [i]Evertsen[/i], the second Dutch shipgirl in the game. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[twin braids]], [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and is [[barefoot]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] top, [[covered navel]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]], [[green coat]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], and a [[thigh strap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two floating hull pieces, one with a 120 mm single gun mount and another with 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], plus a [[book]].

title: de_zeven_provincien_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Dutch light cruiser HNLMS [i]De Zeven Provinciën[/i] (C802), the first Royal Netherlands Navy shipgirl in the game. 

She is portrayed as an [[elf]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[green hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]], [[green eyes]], [[large breasts]], and is [[barefoot]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]] with a [[center opening|navel cutout]], [[green coat]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[green thighhighs|green]] [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg, and a [[butterfly hair ornament]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces with two 152 mm triple gun mounts per side, and a [[halo]] above her.

title: hakuryuu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the aircraft carrier [i]Hakuryuu[/i], as part of a collaboration with [[World of Warships]]. 
Character design by [[Izuru (timbermetal)|]], voiced by [[Satou Satomi]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[mismatched horns]] with her left pointed up and right pointed to the side. Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress|black]] [[pleated dress]] with a [[side slit]], [[black jacket]], [[black gloves]], [[thigh strap]]s, and [[knee pads]]. Her [[rigging]] is a split [[flight deck]] in an animalistic style containing her 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] while she uses an [[huge weapon|oversized]] [[ootachi]] as her melee weapon.

In Azur Lane, she initially behaves in a stereotypical [[sukeban]] manner, often wielding her sword and trying to strike intimidating poses. However, she's actually an air-headed girl who only wants to look cool and is easily flustered, especially if she's without her katana.

title: ohananomitsu_high_school_uniform
body:
The school uniform of the Ohanamitsu high school in [[Kimi no Koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo]].
The school allows a fairly high amount of customisation, but generally the uniform includes a dark purple blazer over a white shirt, a red necktie or ribbon, and dark purple trousers or skirt.

title: porter_robinson_(copyright)
body:
Porter Weston Robinson is an American DJ, singer, and songwriter most known for his debut LP [[Worlds]] and the music video to his single [[Shelter_(song)|]].

His other albums include [[Nurture]] and [[SMILE! :D]].

His mascot is [[Potaro]].

[[Po-uta]] is a Vocaloid inspired by his 'Nurture era'.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[starry hair|starry]] [[purple hair]] with [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[colored inner hair]]. title: airani_iofifteen
body:
Multiglot alien artist [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Area 15|1st generation]]. Designed by [[Yano Mitsuki (nanairo)|]]. Despite being an alien, she looks just like a (short) human being.

She has [[purple eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]]/[[pink hair|light pink]] hair with a [[gradient hair|gradient]] going from [[pink hair|pink]] to [[blue hair|light blue]]. She has [[medium breasts]], although the perspective and the baggy shirt on her default costume given the impression of her having a [[flat chest]]. Her true chest size is more evident in her later costume and 3D model.

Her default hairstyle is a [[side up bun|side-up]] [[single side bun|bun]] that turns into a [[one side up]] and [[side ponytail]], [[swept bangs]] and sidelock, she wears a [[two-tone hairband]] [[pink hairband|pink]] and [[green hairband|green]] [[bow hairband]] and a palette [[hair ornament]].

title: madeon_(copyright)
body:
Hugo Pierre Leclercq, better known by his stage name [[Madeon]], is a French DJ, singer, songwriter, and producer currently located in Los Angeles, CA.

His 2015 album [[Adventure_(madeon)|]] and 2019 album Good Faith are very notable within the EDM scene, the latter of the two having been nominated for a Grammy.

He is also very well known for his single [[Shelter_(song)|]].

title: psylocke
body:
An [[X-Men]] character with the powers of [[telepathy]] and [[telekinesis]].

The first Psylocke was Elizabeth "Betsy" Braddock, a British woman who was the twin sister of Brian Braddock, aka [[Captain Britain]]. When Betsy was captured by the Mandarin, she ended switching bodies with a Japanese ninja mutant named Kwannon, which Betsy continue to use her codename Psylocke in her new Japanese body over 29 years. Eventually both Betsy and Kwannon switch back to their original bodies with Betsy becoming the new Captain Britain while Kwannon becomes the second Psylocke.

A third Psylocke was introduced in Marvel's 2021 Demon Days mini comic series set in a Marvel universe that merged with Japanese mythology. This version of Psylocke is named [[Psylocke (sai)|Sai]], a wandering [[Samurai]] who hunts [[traditional youkai|Yokai]] with her psionic powers. The Psylocke Sai would later appear in the video game [[Marvel Rivals]].

As a result of her confusing backstory, Psylocke is either portrayed as British, Japanese or British Asian in other media.

In film, she appears in [[X-Men: The Last Stand]] and [[X-Men: Apocalypse]] in the [[X-Men film series]]. In videogames, she appears in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series and in [[Marvel Rivals]].

h4. Appearance

title: single-shoulder_dress
body:
A dress with an asymmetrical, diagonal-shaped neckline, leaving a portion of the upper chest area and at least one shoulder [[bare shoulders|bare]]. These dresses are typically supported by a [[single sleeve]] or a [[single strap]] on one shoulder while the other is left bare. The neckline of the dress starts on top of one shoulder ends underneath the armpit between the torso and opposite arm.

h4.Correct examples

title: vera:_garnet_(wavebender)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Vera (pgr)|]]'s [[vera: garnet (pgr)|Garnet frame]].

Wavebender coating is a summer apparel for the Garnet frame, no mechanical bodily features, and major changes to her hair style. Wavebender coating features [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|red]] and [[blue hair]] though primarily red, with blue coloured [[colored inner hair|inner hair]] and blue [[streaked hair|streaks]], styled with [[asymmetrical bangs]] and a single [[braid]] behind left ear, adorned with two [[hairclip]]s. Wears a pair of [[sunglasses]], a [[white headwear|white]] [[cabbie hat]] and has two [[fish skeleton earrings]].

Upper body apparel consist of a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[see-through jacket|see-through]] [[open jacket]], and a [[red bikini|red]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] fabric/collar covering her chest. Lower body has a pair of [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]] with [[suspenders]]. Footwear is a pair of [[high heels|high heeled]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]].

title: michi_mochievee_(bunny)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VShojo]]'s [[Michi Mochievee]].

As a [[rabbit girl]], she wears a [[white sweater]] with [[long sleeves|sleeves]] [[sleeves past wrists|past the wrist]] and a [[turtleneck sweater|turtleneck collar]], a [[black leotard]] beneath, a [[single fishnet legwear|single finshnet]] [[fishnet thighhighs|thighigh]], a [[uneven legwear|singular]] [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks|ankle sock]], and [[single thighhighs|single]] [[torn thighhighs|torn]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]]. She also has two [[doll|dolls]] of [[Jared (Michi Mochievee)|]] strapped on her waist, a [[price tag]] on her collar, and [[round eyewear|round]] [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]]. 

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], she has [[purple hair|purple]] [[short hair|short-length hair]] with the usual [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], alongside [[long sidelocks]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored tips]]. She now also sports a pair of [[rabbit ears]] that extend sideways.

title: rio_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. President of Millennium's student council, [[Seminar (blue archive)|]]. Nicknamed "Big Sister", in reference to [[Big Brother (1984)]].

Her full name is Tsukatsuki Rio.

Her firearm is [[M1911]] pistol.

Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] decorated with a single [[hairclip]] and [[red eyes]] with [[white pupils]]. Wears a [[white sweater|white]] [[turtleneck sweater]] underneath a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with a [[id card]]. Also wears a [[pleated skirt]] over [[pantyhose]], a [[holster]] [[thigh strap|strapped]] to her [[thigh holster|thigh]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

She is often seen with a [[tablet PC]].

Original artist: [[mx2j]]
Voiced by: [[Lynn (voice_actor)|]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #8759621: Profile

title: bang_dream!
body:
Stylized as BanG Dream!, a Japanese media franchise created and managed by [[Bushiroad]]. 

Originally started as a mobile rhythm game, the franchise later expanded with an anime series being broadcast since January 2017, multiple mini anime series, several manga series, and live concerts in which the voice actresses for six of the bands ([[Poppin'Party]], [[Roselia (bang dream!)|]], [[RAISE A SUILEN]], [[Morfonica]], [[MyGO!!!!! (bang dream!)|]], and [[Ave Mujica (bang dream!)|]]) perform their instruments and respective roles.

In 2023, all of the main casts received a 3D live tracking model for their live and online performance, essentially making them pseudo-[[virtual youtuber]].

title: shelter_(song)
body:
[i]Shelter[/i] is an animated music video created by musicians [[Porter Robinson_(copyright)|]] and [[Madeon_(copyright)|]], in collaboration with [[A-1 Pictures]] and [[Crunchyroll]]. 

Shelter tells the story of Rin, a 17-year-old girl who lives her life inside of a futuristic simulation completely by herself in infinite, beautiful loneliness. Each day, Rin awakens in virtual reality and uses a tablet which controls the simulation to create a new, different, beautiful world for herself. Until one day, everything changes, and Rin comes to learn the true origins behind her life inside a simulation.

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Music video":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fzQ6gRAEoy0

title: tag_group:fine_art_parody
body: [See [[tag groups]].] A collection of all identified [[fine art parody|fine art parodies]] on Danbooru, sorted alphabetically by the original artist's name. Western artists are sorted firstname-lastname, while Japanese artists are vice-versa. Artists with easily-identifiable mononyms will utilize those mononyms instead (e.g. Picasso for Pablo Picasso, and Michelangelo for Michelangelo di Lodovico Buonarroti Simoni). h4. Works h6. Alexandre Cabanel * !asset #22069549: [[Fallen Angel (painting)|]] h6. Andrea Solario * !asset #24469325: [[Salome with the Head of Saint John the Baptist]] h6. Antonio da Correggio * !asset #24469315: [[Noli me Tangere]] h6. Arnold Böcklin * !asset #24469313: [[Self-Portrait with Death Playing the Fiddle]] h6. Caravaggio * !asset #24469303: [[David with the Head of Goliath]] h6. Claude Monet * !asset #22069602: [[Woman with a Parasol]] h6. Édouard Manet * !asset #25524523: [[Olympia (manet)|]] h6. title: pinafore_dress
body:
A pinafore dress or jumper (US English) is a sleeveless, collarless dress intended to be worn over a [[blouse]], [[shirt]] or [[sweater]].

Not to be confused with an [[apron]], which has no back, distinctively.

For jumper (UK English) see [[sweater]].

Do not confuse this tag with [[suspender_skirt|suspender skirt]], [[high-waist skirt]], [[overall skirt]] or [[skirt set]].

h4. See also
* [[Tag group:Attire]]
* [[Tag group:Dress]]

title: chevalier_d'eon_(fate)
body:
Saber-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The Knight of White Lilies, their Noble Phantasm is Fleur de Lys.

d'Eon's gender is [[1other|not identified]], and they possess a skill that allows them to [[genderswap|switch]] between the two. d'Eon's real life counterpart was biologically male and [[crossdressing|crossdressed]] while undercover as a spy before [[gender transitioning|transitioning to living as a woman]] later in life. They briefly wear a purple [[maid]] uniform during the Agartha chapter.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Moriyama Daisuke]]

title: innertube
body:
A flotation device used as a recreational swimming aid, especially by young children and older persons who cannot swim. So called because it resembles (and in earlier times, usually [i]was[/i]) the inner tube of a car tire.

On Danbooru, often constructed of [[transparent]] material, ostensibly for better visibility of the wearer.

A [[lifebuoy]] is visually similar, but its use and usual material composition are different.

h4. See also
* [[inflatable armbands]]

* [[donut innertube]]

* [[watermelon innertube]]
* [[innertube with ears]]

title: space_ishtar_(first_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Space Ishtar (fate)|]]'s first ascension from [[Fate/Grand Order]], known as [b]Astarte[/b]. She wears a black bodysuit with gold and glowing red trim. Her eyes are colored grey in this form.

In the [[Saber Wars II]] event, she kidnapped the player character and brought them to the Servant Universe where she resides, hoping to use them in her plan to take over the galaxy. She is one of the fragments of the primordial goddess [[Space Ishtar (Astarte Origin) (fate)|Astarte Origin]] who was raised by [[Yagyuu Munenori (fate)|Munenori]] to become the leader of the Space Shinkageryuu. [spoiler]While initially assumed to be goddess' evil half, it is revealed she is actually the good half.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !post #9206409

h4. Unnamed costumes
* !post #7503817

h4. External Links

title: space_ishtar_(second_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Space Ishtar (fate)|]]'s second ascension from [[Fate/Grand Order]], nicknamed [b]Ishtarin[/b] by [[Calamity Jane (fate)|]]. She wears a yellow vest, a blue bandeau, yellow fingerless gloves, yellow shorts, a bandage on her left knee, and yellow knee boots. Her eyes are colored red in this form.

In the Saber Wars II event, she allies herself with the player character, trying to help them find a way back to their own universe after they escaped from Astarte. She is one of the fragments of the primordial goddess [[Space Ishtar (Astarte Origin) (fate)|Astarte Origin]] who was raised by [[Tohsaka Tokiomi|Professor Tokiomi]] and became a bounty hunter working alongside [[Calamity Jane (fate)|]] after his death. [spoiler]While initially assumed to be goddess' good half, it is revealed she is actually the evil half.[/spoiler]

title: space_ishtar_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Space Ishtar (fate)|]]'s third ascension from [[Fate/Grand Order]], known as [b]Ishtar Astarte[/b]. Her hair changes color to purple with a blue underside, she has an upside-down crescent on her forehead, and her eyes become yellow with mismatched shapes in her pupils (a circle in her right eye, and a star in her left). She wears a red and orange bodysuit beneath a heavy red cloak with snake-like ropes coiling through it.

In the [[Saber Wars II]] event, this Ascension was the fusion between Space Ishtar's first and second ascensions in order to fight against Astarte Origin. She's in a sense, a newborn galaxy, and was able to win against Astarte Origin due to Astarte Origin being stuck in the past while Ishtar Ashtart was able to look into the future.

[[Space Ishtar (Astarte Origin) (fate)|]] is a recolor of this Ascension.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9206411

In Saber Wars II, Astarte Origin was a major antagonist, seeking to destroy the servant universe. [spoiler]She is the leftover body of the goddess Astarte, after she split her personality between the good and evil halves who became their own Space Ishtars.[/spoiler]

title: okita_j._souji_(fate)
body:
Swimsuit Assassin-class version of [[Okita Souji (fate)|]], first appearing in the [[Kenzan! Las Vegas Gozenjiai]] event. Wears a [[black bikini]] with a [[black scarf]] around her neck in her first two ascensions, and a [[white bikini]] in her third. The J in her name stands for "jet", in reference to the [[jetpack]] strapped to her back.

The jetpack is Servant Universe technology that was affixed to her back as a form of life support after [[Mysterious Heroine XX (fate)|]] mistakenly believed she killed her. Because of this, she has a low rank Existence Outside the Domain skill reserved for Foreigner-class servants. Conversely, her Weak Constitution skill has been removed, allowing for superior combat abilities.

For her Alter variant's swimsuit version, see [[Okita Souji Alter (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yuuki Aoi]]

title: hair_flip
body:
The act of using one's hand to flip a strand of hair away. Usually associated with elegant characters.

This is [b]not[/b] the tag for the winged type of hairstyle where the hair curls at the tips. For that, use [[flipped hair]].

Not to be confused with [[whipping hair]].

title: precure
body:
A [[magical girl]] anime franchise created by Izumi Todo and produced by [[Toei Animation]].

The [i]Pretty Cure[/i], or [i]PreCure[/i], are girls who are chosen to transform into magical girls to protect the earth. Though their origins differ throughout each series, they are always referred to as 'legendary warriors'. Whilst most later Cures are able to transform individually, some Cures, particularly in earlier series, often have to transform in pairs. Generally in each series, the girls chosen to become Pretty Cure are in middle school, though in recent series, there have been older and younger Pretty Cures as well as male Pretty Cures.

title: italia_(kancolle)
body:
The upgraded form of [[Littorio (kancolle)|]] in [[Kantai Collection]].  Her name simply means "Italy".

Virtually identical in appearance, the only differences outside of stats is that her [[machinery|combat gear]] no longer has the white-and-red stripes, and she has additional secondary [[ship turret|turret]]s.  

Her summer seasonal CG is almost identical to her unremodelled portrait. She simply ditches the pareo for a towel and her mouth is open.

Her Christmas seasonal CG is also almost identical to her unremodelled portrait. She simply gave her scarf to the Roma snowman.

Historically, [i]Italia[/i] was the rename of [i]Littorio[/i] after [[Benito Mussolini]] fell from power, and [i]Littorio[/i] was captured by the Allies, as the original name had Fascist connotations.

title: fletcher_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of "USS [i]Fletcher[/i] (hull number DD-445)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Fletcher_(DD-445)], nameship of the US Navy's 175 Fletcher-class destroyers. Her namesake (and namesake of the class) is Navy Admiral "Frank Friday Fletcher (1855-1928)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Friday_Fletcher], who served in the 19th and 20th centuries, most notably as commander of naval forces at the "Battle of Veracruz":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_occupation_of_Veracruz] in Mexico. She is designed by [[Zeco]], who also illustrated the first of her class in the game, [[johnston (kancolle)|Johnston]].

The Fletcher class was the most numerous of the destroyers that participated in World War II, built completely free from any treaty restrictions with a larger size, larger fuel capacity and range, and better armaments. In the world of Kantai Collection, this translates to Fletcher and Johnston being tall and having ample bustlines; among the other non-Japanese destroyers before them, only [[tashkent (kancolle)|Tashkent]] is comparable in those areas while the others are implied to have flat chests.

Being the nameship of the class, Fletcher herself is given traits of [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with triangular [[double bun|side buns]], [[purple eyes]], and a [[large breasts|very well-endowed]] body. Her outfit is similar to Johnston's but with the black features being given lighter colors: a stylized [[serafuku]] which consists of an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[blue shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]] that exposes her [[cleavage]], a [[yellow neckerchief]], and a short [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], along with [[white thighhighs]] that are shielded by what seem to be metallic thigh and [[shin guards]] and red [[rudder footwear|rudder shoes]]. She also wears [[white gloves|white short gloves]] and a metallic [[hairband]]. In her remodeled form, she adds a [[star hair ornament]] to each side of her hairband.

Her [[rigging]] consists of two [[smokestack]]s and two 5-inch [[cannon]] [[ship turret]]s with one set on each side of her rigging. Her hull number is emblazoned on each side of her lower rigs. She also carries a [[cargo net]], a reference to her rescuing many survivors of the USS [i][[Northampton (kancolle)|]][/i] during the "Battle of Tassafaronga":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Tassafaronga] by using cork-floated cargo nets.

On her [[Fletcher Kai (kancolle)|Kai remodel]], Fletcher gains a silver [[star hair ornament]] on each side of her hairband, and her rigging gains an additional radar set atop the director and loses its blue camoflage in favor of standard grey color.

Fletcher is the first non-Japanese destroyer in the game to get a second remodel, and winds up with [i]two[/i] [[Fletcher Mk II (kancolle)|reversible modes]]. In both of them, she loses the cargo net and gains a pair of [[headphones]]. One of the modes gives her a quintuple torpedo launcher to carry, while the other completely redoes her rigging, giving her experimental ASW equipment to carry, making her headband more angular (mimicking the changed shape of her bridge), and changing the color of her skirt and thighhighs from white to black.
