title: colorado_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Colorado[/i] (BB-45). 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]].

h4. Appearance

Like [[iowa (kancolle)|Iowa]] before her, she is given traits, based upon some old WWII-era US Navy pin-ups such as: [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[side braids]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[large breasts|well endowed]] yet petite body. She wears a [[grey hat|grey]] [[garrison cap]], yardarm [[headgear]] that is already typical for the Big 7, a two-part [[grey dress|gray]] [[pleated dress]] with blue accents and a [[sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] that [[sideboob|exposes one side of each breast]], a [[blue necktie]] with the number 45 on it, [[black gloves|black]] and grey [[elbow gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], a grey [[capelet]] with blue underside, and red [[high heels|high-heeled shoes]].

Her machinery includes her famed 16-inch guns (four at each side in twin [[ship turret|turrets]]), a [[smokestack]] and a [[lattice mast]] with a large clock face among others. She is given a remodel which trades the clock face for a radar antenna atop the mast, paints her wooden deck grey and modernizes her secondary and anti-aircraft guns.

h4. History

The historical USS [i]Colorado[/i] saw a long and active career that took her into both Atlantic and Pacific oceans. She participated in a number of fleet exercises in the inter-war years, and also briefly served in various tasks such as becoming a training ship, and even assisting in the search for Amelia Earhart. During WWII, [i]Colorado[/i] saw extensive action throughout the Pacific against the Japanese, being a constant presence in pre-invasion shelling and fire support actions from Tarawa all the way to Okinawa. For her service, the battleship was awarded seven battle stars. After the war, she participated in "Operation Magic Carpet" to bring US troops back home. She was decommissioned in 1947 and sold for scrap in 1959.

h4. Trivia

She is named after the state of Colorado, the second such ship in the US Navy but the third to carry the name (the first USS [i]Colorado[/i], a steam screw frigate, was named after the Colorado River).

She is the first foreign shipgirl as well as the first personified battleship for her artist [[Parsley-f]]. She is also the fourth (second foreign) member of the so-called Big 7 (the seven battleships with 16-inch guns built before WWII) in the game, joining [[nagato (kancolle)|Nagato]], [[mutsu (kancolle)|Mutsu]], and [[nelson (kancolle)|Nelson]].

In comparison to the other Big 7 in the game, she is given a petite body and a more youthful appearance, reflecting the fact the Colorado-class battleships were the shortest of the Big 7 at 624 feet 3 inches (190.27 m) each, compared to the Nagato-class at 708 feet (215.8 m; later lengthened to 738 feet/224.94 m) each and the Nelson-class at 710 feet (216.4 m) each. In spite of this shorter length, their displacement was equal to that of her counterparts, at 32,600 long tons unloaded (compare the Nagato-class at 32,200 long tons and the Nelson-class at 33,300 long tons), which is reflected by her curvaceous figure and ample bosom.

h4. [i]Colorado[/i]-class battleships
* [b]Colorado[/b] (BB-45)
* [[Maryland (Kancolle)]] (BB-46)

h4. See also
* [[Colorado (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Colorado (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links

* "Kancolle Wikia: Colorado":[https://kancolle.fandom.com/Colorado]
* "Kancolle Wiki: Colorado":[http://en.kancollewiki.net/Colorado]
* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Colorado[/i] (BB-45)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Colorado_(BB-45)]

title: verniy_(kancolle)
body:
The post-WWII/Soviet/Kai2 form of [[Hibiki (kancolle)|]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She replaces the sailor shirt shared with the rest of the Akatsuki class with a [[belt|belted]] button-up sailor shirt and her hat is now white with red trimmings, with a [[hammer and sickle]] and [[star (symbol)|]] pin on it. As for her [[torpedo tubes]], she replaces her Japanese 61 cm triple mounts with Soviet 53.3 cm quad mounts on either side. Curiously, she retains her 12.7 twin gun mount Type B to her right. 

h4. Trivia

Often nicknamed "Bep" (as if the cyrillic letters "Вер" were read as Latin letters), "Beppu" ("別府", same thing but as a pun to the city of the same name) or "Nuinui" ("ヌイヌイ", like [[Shiranui (kancolle)|]], so it's not uncommon to see the two being paired together) as her name might be difficult to pronounce for the Japanese (and most non-Russian speakers alike).

In-game, she is characterized with a lack of stock equipment (she predates [[Gangut (kancolle)|]]'s appearance by 3.5 years and [[Tashkent (kancolle)|]]'s - who actually used some of the equipment that Verniy would be equipped with - by 4.5 years, and thus such equipment were unavailable in-game when Verniy came out), a relatively low luck for her sheer longevity (she was only lucky in the way she avoided combat by being in repairs), and her high resilience compared to destroyers of her size (only Suzutsuki and Tashkent exceeds her in health, both are also significantly larger than Verniy, only Shimakaze, Yukikaze and Amatsukaze exceeds her armor but none of them can equip bulges, which Verniy can).

h4. Appearance

* !post #1566678: Default
* !post #2872435: [[Verniy (Saury Festival) (kancolle)|Saury Festival]]

h4. Special Type destroyers with kai ni
h5. [b]Akatsuki-class[/b]
* [[Akatsuki Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Verniy[/b]

title: fusou_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body: For her second remodel, Fusou gains a [[floral print|floral pattern]] on select parts of her shirt and sleeves. Her skirt's golden floral pattern and metallic [[epaulettes]] (which were present on her original art but were pratically inexistant in fanart) have been heavily emphasized as well. Her pagoda mast hair ornament is even more ornate, a white [[headband]] is added and her hair is tied low. She also gains two heavy triple guns where two (unremodelled) or one (first remodel) heavy twin guns were previously, bumping her firepower (which was gimped in her first remodel) higher than her unremodelled form's.

title: original_remodel_(kantai_collection)
body:
Term applied to a fan artist's own rendition of what a particular [[Kantai Collection]] character's second remodel would look like, either in clothes, gear, or both. This tag applies to a shipgirl whose second remodel has yet to be implemented at the time of drawing, especially if that shipgirl would eventually get an official second remodel that is significantly different than what the fan artist imagined.

So-called "third remodels" also count as original remodels; [[Bismarck (kancolle)|]] has an official "Drei" form, [[Kongou (kancolle)|]] has an official third "what if" remodel, [[Shigure (kancolle)|]] has also been given [[shigure kai san_(kancolle)|a third retrofit]], and no other shipgirl has a form beyond a second remodel, barring seasonal CGs, although [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]]'s nominal second remodel can be considered an actual third remodel due to the existence of her [[tan yang (kancolle)|Tan Yang]] form. Hypothetical costumes and gear that come with a yet-to-be-implemented eventual name change or form (such as Tan Yang's, pre-official implementation) can also be considered original remodels.

The tag is especially useful if a shipgirl, such as a destroyer, is given an outfit similar to those worn by her officially remodeled sisters. This is typical for shipgirls of the same class and/or fleshed out by the same illustrator.

Even if an original remodel correctly predicts an official remodel, this tag should be used depending on when the original remodel was published in relation to the release of the official one. [[shikinami (kancolle)|Shikinami's]] is a good example; her second remodel was made known through the official Kancolle calendar for 2020 (announced November 2019), but some fan artists have drawn it in some form long before that, probably using [[ayanami (kancolle)|Ayanami's]] as the basis (such as post #3841559, posted on Twitter April 2, 2019). [[yura (kancolle)|Yura's]] is another example; post #2534054 guessed in late 2016 her second remodeled form which was mostly confirmed as first teased on Comptiq's June 2017 issue (post #2719435).

h4. Examples
Compare these remodels as envisioned by [[Minosu]]...

title: kantai_collection
body:
[i]Kantai Collection[/i] (艦隊これくしょん [i]Kantai Korekushon[/i], lit. "Combined Fleet Collection"), abbreviated as [i]KanColle[/i] (艦これ [i]KanKore[/i]), is a Japanese free-to-play shipgirl-themed game developed by [[c2_kikan]] under [[Kadokawa|Kadokawa Games]] and published by [[DMM]]. It is currently available exclusively in Japanese, though it has started to introduce some English-language graphical assets, and accessing the game for non-Japanese players requiring unconventional means.

h4. Gameplay

Gameplay is centered upon building squadrons composed of individual characters represented as cards with different attributes, and then sending said squadrons out on missions. The player takes on the role of an [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] (提督 [i]teitoku[/i]) and organises their fleets in battle in order to win. Combat is largely automated, and manual actions by the player include micromanagement such as building and repairing.

Each of the characters are moe [[personification]]s of [[World War II]] naval [[warship]]s, which are depicted as cute girls known as "ship girls" (艦娘, [i]kanmusu[/i]). These personified warships are based on real life vessels which are explained in detail within the game; the physical characteristics, appearances and personalities of each of the girls correlate in some way to the real life vessel.

Originally, the roster of the shipgirls was designed to be limited to the IJN and major players of the Imperial Japanese Army, and its final mission being an attack on the base, akin to how World War 2 played out for Japan. Due to the game's popularity, it has since introduced shipgirls from other Axis nations and wartime rival factions, including ships from the U.S. Navy, the British Royal Navy and even the somewhat-neutral Swedish Navy. 

As of early 2022, KanColle features ships from following navies: Imperial Japanese Navy, Imperial Japanese Army, Maritime Safety Agency/Japan Coast Guard, United States Navy, British Royal Navy, Royal Australian Navy, Dutch Koninklijke Marine, French Marine nationale, Italian Regia Marina, German Kriegsmarine, Военно-морской флот СССР, Swedish Svenska marinen, and Republic of China Navy. With the most numerous non-Japanese navies being United States Navy and Regia Marina.

h4. Media

The game has developed into a much larger media franchise; various media including multiple manga series and light novels have been released, in addition to an officially licensed [[tabletop rpg|tabletop role-playing game]]. A [[PlayStation Vita]] game was released February 2016. A [[Kantai Collection (anime)|television anime adaptation]] aired Winter 2015, with a sequel season airing in 2022, and an anime movie was released in 2016. There is also a Japan only 3D arcade game [[Kancolle Arcade]] that was released in 2016.

h4. History

The web browser game was launched on April 23, 2013, originally designed to run in Adobe Flash. An Android app version was released on August 1st, 2016. As of January 2015, the game had 2.5 million registered players. The game migrated to HTML5 prior to worldwide decommissioning of Adobe Flash in browsers.

h4. Tagging

Don't tag shipgirls with [[mecha musume]], [[personification]],  [[World War II]], or [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], unless these things are present outside of the shipgirls themselves.

Don't tag shipgirls of the same class as [[sisters]].

title: remilia_scarlet
body:
The "Scarlet Devil". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character.

[[vampire|Vampiric]] mistress of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] of at least 500 years of age despite her childish appearance, whose title comes from the bloodstains on her clothes and her fearsome ability to manipulate fate. Nevertheless, she is refined and friendly, if somewhat bratty. Besides her younger sister [[flandre_scarlet|Flandre]] and the rest of her household - head maid and personal attendant [[Izayoi Sakuya]], gatekeeper [[Hong Meiling]], and librarian [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and the little devil [[Koakuma]], among others - she is also good friends with her one-time nemesis, [[Hakurei Reimu]]. Atypical of vampires, Remilia has a low appetite for blood.

Sometimes drawn with her weapon, [[Spear the Gungnir]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7476325: Usual Appearance

h4. See also

* [[uu~]]
* [[Miserable Fate]]
* [[Charisma Guard]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Remilia Scarlet":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Remilia_Scarlet
other_names: レミリア・スカーレット

title: maitake_dance
body:
A dance originating from a YouTube short posted by the [[hololive DEV_IS]]'s [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Juufuutei Raden]] on August 6th, 2024. The short shows an animation by [[Bakakun]] of a [[chibi]] Raden dancing while she sings a song about [[maitake (mushroom)|maitake mushrooms]]. It was part of a series of other short videos she made about various types of mushrooms (pool #23983).

Thanks to its energetic, earworm lyrics, the short went viral. It accumulated millions of views in just a few months and inspired various memes, parodies, and videos of people performing the dance.

h4. See also

* "Original Video":[https://youtube.com/shorts/hymOcFUkCHU] (post #8132428)
* "KnowYourMeme Entry":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/maitake-guru-guru]

title: guest_art
body:
[[Official art]] created by a guest artist. Either commissioned by a copyright holder or is [[gift art|gifted]] to the author of the work by other established artist.

This is often seen in the end matter for published manga or books (e.g. alongside the work's primary artist's afterword), or featured in [[end card]]s or [[eyecatch]]es in animated works, or in specially produced extra content, officially sanctioned [[promotional art]], and the like.

Don't use this tag for images posted in [[artist collaboration|collaborative]] works where no one artist dominates the artwork, even if one artist officially edits and publishes the work and/or solicits work from other artists.

h4. See also
* [[gift art]]
* Pool #1338 ("Popular Artists Draw Other Copyrights")

body:

This one is based on her [[Artoria Pendragon (lancer) (fate)|Lancer]] version, sporting a [[playboy bunny]] outfit. While she calls herself the Summer Lion King and has the same lime [[green eyes]] with [[bright pupils]] as the [[Lion King (Lancer) (fate)|Lion King]] appearing in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] singularity, she says she is "entirely different".

title: daybreak_(kid_icarus)
body:
A powerful cannon-like weapon from [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], appearing exclusively in multiplayer gameplay. When all three parts of the Daybreak are assembled, its wielder can fire a massive energy beam that knocks out any opponents it connects with. 
It also appears with the same use and effect in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series, sharing this distinction with the [[Dragoon (kirby)|]].

As shown in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] and [[Fate/Zero]], she is a [[blonde hair]]ed woman with [[blue eyes|blue]] eyes ([[purple eyes|purple]] when in [[Laeticia (fate)|]]'s body), having a long [[braid]] and is always seen wearing set of [[armor]] including [[headpiece]], [[faulds]], [[gauntlets]], [[plackart]]; and a pair of black [[thighhighs]].

title: ding_(vessel)
body:
[b]Dǐng[/b] (Chinese: 鼎) are prehistoric and ancient Chinese cauldrons standing upon legs with a lid and two fancy facing handles. They are one of the most important shapes used in Chinese ritual bronzes.

title: frankenstein's_monster_(fate)
body:
The Berserker of "Black" servant of [[Caules Forvedge Yggdmillennia]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. Typically referred as "Fran" for short, and only referred to as "Frankenstein" in official material. She appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] debuting in the [[London (fate/grand order)|]] singularity.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] [[hair over eyes|that usually covers her]] [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[yellow eyes]], a [[single horn]] on the forehead, [[headgear|cylindrical objects]] on her ears and uses a [[mace]] as her weapon. She wears a [[white dress]] that has a black [[see-through cleavage|see-through portion on the chest area]], [[elbow gloves|long]] [[white gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] and a black [[veil]] on her head.

She is depicted as a [[long hair]]ed girl with feline attributes such as cat ears and a tail, perhaps a nod to her legend where she was turned into a lioness. She is usually shown wearing a green dress with puffy shoulders, a short skirt and [[bodice]], as well as clawed [[gauntlets]], [[thigh boots|thigh_boots]] and her [[bow (weapon)|bow]].

title: musashibou_benkei_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant developed for [[Fate/Apocrypha]] and properly appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. [[ushiwakamaru (fate)|Ushiwakamaru]] (Minamoto no Yoshitsune)'s retainer, and a warrior monk who is famous for his loyalty and strength.

[spoiler]However, this "Benkei" is not actually the true Benkei himself, but merely an ordinary soldier under Benkei's command who were so impressed with his master's chivalry that, after he survived the downfall of both Yoshitsune and Benkei, he lived the rest of his life of that of Benkei's and spread his tale. Resulting into him being enshrined as the folk hero "Benkei" in the Throne of Heroes.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Terada Katsuya]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Shinjirou]]

title: siegfried_(fate)
body:
Saber-class Servant in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. He is the hero portrayed as the main character of the German [[Nibelungenlied]] epic. He has [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] with a set of [[armor]] and his weapon, [[Balmung (fate)|]].

Due to his timid personality and his habit of saying sorry due to him being afraid to offend anyone, he has gained the nickname "Sumanai-san" (Mr. I'm sorry) from the fanbase. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], it is revealed that this habit is the result of his wife [[Kriemhild (fate)|]]'s assertive behavior.

[b]True Name:[/b] Siegfried, the Dragon-Blooded Knight
[b]Memetic name:[/b] [i]"Sumanai-san (Mr. I'm sorry)":[https://web.archive.org/web/20170805115136/https://www.reddit.com/r/grandorder/comments/57h4bg/servant_trivia_6_siegfried_the_strongest_evil/][/i]

title: katsushika_hokusai_(swimsuit_saber)_(fate)
body:
Swimsuit version of [[Katsushika Hokusai (fate)|]], though technically it is Katsushika Oui wearing the swimsuit. [[Tokitarou (fate)|]] consistently remains the same, wearing swimming goggles and having long tentacles on the sides of his head. Her Noble Phantasm is "Shokoku Taki-meguri", a consecutive attack set against the backdrop of multiple paintings of waterfalls.

Carries three katana, and one western sword, which Oui and her father wield with great proficiency. Personality-wise, this is Oui during her youth, where she enjoyed reading yomihon and dreaming of being a sword-wielding heroine.

Obtainable as a welfare servant during the [[Kenzan! Las Vegas Gozenjiai]] event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yukana]] (Katsushika Oui)

title: ranma_1/2
body:
[b]Ranma ½[/b] (らんま½, Ranma Nibun-no-Ichi?, pronounced Ranma One-Half) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Takahashi Rumiko]] and first published in 1987. The story revolves around a 16-year old boy named Ranma Saotome who was trained from early childhood in martial arts. As a result of an accident during a training journey, he is cursed to become a girl when splashed with cold water, but hot water will change him back into a boy. It has two anime adaptations, one originally made in 1989, and a newer one from 2024.

h4. Characters

* [[Saotome Ranma]] / [[Ranma-chan]]

title: yozora_mel_(streetwear)
body:
The 7th and final [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Yozora Mel]].

It's a [[streetwear]]-themed costume consisting of a [[black headwear|black]] [[cat hat|cat ear-shaped]] [[baseball cap]] with "YZR" written on it, a [[black collar]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]] worn over a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white tank top]] with a [[heart cutout|heart-shaped]] [[cleavage cutout]] and an [[underbust]] [[chest belt]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[orange skirt|orange]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[belt]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[black thighhighs]] with one regular thighhigh on one leg and a [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] [[single fishnet legwear|on the other]], held with a [[single legwear garter|garter]] with  [[star o-ring|star]] [[o-ring]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[high tops]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair]] in a [[wide ponytail]] with long [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]], decorated with multiple [[hairclip]]s on one side and either the [[bat hair ornament|bat-shaped]] or the [[star hair ornament|star-shaped]] hairclips from her previous costumes on the other. She also has [[extra ears|extra]] [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]]  with a [[tail ribbon]] and [[ear piercing]] on both her human and [[cat ears]].

* !post #7129214: Merchandise

It consists of a [[black bustier|black]] [[cross-laced clothes|cross-laced]] [[bustier]] with [[mini wings|miniature]] [[red wings|red]] [[bat wings]] on the back, [[short sleeves|short]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]] with [[sleeve garter]]s, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[overskirt]], [[black panties|black]] [[highleg panties]], a [[thigh strap]], [[uneven legwear]] (a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]] with a [[single garter strap|garter strap]] and a [[black socks|black]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]]) and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots]] with [[winged footwear|wings]] on them.

title: dainenjiyama_aisho
body:
Aisho Dainenjiyama (大年寺山 愛唱, Dainenjiyama Aishō) is a tertiary antagonist featured in the eighth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[JoJolion]].
Aisho is a baseball stadium security guard who is [spoilers] secretly a Rock Human working under the Locacaca Organization as a smuggler and dealer.  [/spoilers]He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user, wielding the [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Doobie Wah!]]

Aisho is a slender man of average to below average height. His outfit is composed of a skin-tight [[black bodysuit]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a khaki shorts with a belt, and a two-toned layered arm sleeves. He dons what appears to be a knitted wrap scarf with sleeves tied around his neck. He also wears a pair of sleeves around his head, similar to the pattern on his neck wrap scarf, with some of his hair poking out through the holes.

title: z-move
body:
A special kind of [[pokemon move|Pokémon move]] usable in [[pokemon sm|Pokémon Sun and Moon]] and [[pokemon usum|Ultra Sun and Moon]]. Using a Z-Move requires both a [[Z-Ring]] and a [[Z-Crystal]]. Before the move is used, the Trainer [[z-move trainer pose|strikes a pose]].

h4. List of Z-Moves
h5. Type-based

* [[Supersonic Skystrike (pokemon)|]] (Flying)

title: chocolate_disco
body:
Chocolate Disco (チョコレート・ディスコ, Chokorēto Disuko) is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[disco_(sbr)|D-I-S-C-O]], featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].

Chocolate Disco manifests itself as an [[armband]] on [[disco_(sbr)|D-I-S-C-O's]] forearm, which has the ability to divide the nearby environment into a grid and reposition anyone caught in the grid at will.
Chocolate Disco is a forearm guard resembling a vambrace. It has a grid pattern of 26 lettered rows and 10 numbered columns serving as coordinates, similarly to the board game [[Battleship]]. Each cell can be pressed.

Namesake — Chocolate Disco (Perfume song)
other_names: チョコレート・ディスコ

title: disco_(sbr)
body:
D-ID-I-S-C-O  (ディ・ス・コ, Di-su-ko) is a tertiary antagonist featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].
He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user, wielding the gauntlet-like [[Chocolate Disco]].

D-I-S-C-O is a tall slim man, with medium-length messy, curly dark hair with a large, rectangular [[hair clip]]/accessory sitting on the left side of his head. Shaved [[beard]] and [[mustache]] can be spotted around his face.

He wears a [[long coat]] similar to the ones worn by the police officers from the 18th century; wearing his  [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Chocolate Disco]] like an [[armband]] on his left forearm as well as wearing a handcuff for a [[belt]].

title: hey_ya_(stand)
body:
Hey Ya! (ヘイ・ヤー, Hei Yā) is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Pocoloco]], featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]]. Gripping [[Pocoloco]] from the back, this dwarfish [[Stand (jojo)|]] encourages and advises its user through any hardship.

Hey Ya! is a small, roughly humanoid [[Stand (jojo)|]]. Its head looks like an upturned bucket with two uneven holes for eyes. Hey Ya!'s lower jaw is pinned with bolts, and is lined with small, sharp teeth. There is also a horizontal line of bolts above its mouth.

Hey Ya! has hollow cylinders lining the top of its head with strands of rope-like hair on the ends of them. Its body is robotic with a chest and a lower torso that are connected with a chain-like spine. It also has thin arms, thin legs, and [[shoulder pads]]. On shoulders and hands, tiny bolts can be seen.

Namesake: Hey Ya! (Outkast song)

He is recognizable by his [[teddy bear]]s on his sleeves, and the swirly symbols on his shirt and [[afro]].

title: mighty_morphin_power_rangers:_the_movie
body:
A 1995 American [[tokusatsu]] film. The story is an alternate re-telling of the [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] television series. It stars the ensemble cast of Karan Ashley, [[Johnny Yong Bosch]], Steve Cardenas, Jason David Frank, Amy Jo Johnson, and David Yost alongside the villains cast from the original series and Paul Freeman as Ivan Ooze. 

Much like the television season, it used concepts from the Japanese [[Super Sentai]] series [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]], [[Gosei Sentai Dairanger]] and [[Ninja Sentai Kakuranger]]. It is the first [[Power Rangers]] production from Saban Entertainment not to feature any archived footage from Super Sentai, as well as the first film in the Power Rangers franchise. The designs of the third season's Ninja Rangers are based on the costumes used for the Ninjetti uniforms in this movie.

The design of the Rangers in the movie explicitly features the Power Coins of the [[Dino Buckler|Power Morpher]] on their chests to align how the [[Mighty Morphin White Ranger]]'s chest armor features one, and the suits are made of PVC and metal plating rather than the standard spandex, making them slightly bulkier.

The characters are sentient [[cookie|cookies]], but are often depicted as [[humanization|humanizations]] of their in-game cookie forms. Since the Cookies are already humanoid, the [[personification]] tag should [b]not[/b] be used.

title: ipod_shuffle_4g
body:
The fourth iteration of [[iPod Shuffle]], released in 2010. It has a square shape that is completely taken up by the control wheel, and is commonly worn clipped to the owner's clothes.

The silver model has a black control wheel instead of the [[iPod Shuffle 2G]]'s white.

title: ipod_shuffle_2g
body:
The second iteration of [[iPod Shuffle]], released in 2006. It and all of the subsequent models come in a very wide color range.

It is a small rectangle with a control wheel on one side.

* !post #400914

title: ipod_shuffle_1g
body: The first iteration of [[iPod Shuffle]], released in 2005 in only white. It has an elongated shape with buttons arranged in a circle at the top, almost resembling a remote.

title: ipod_shuffle
body:
A smaller version of the [[iPod]] with no display interface, just buttons for playback. Its earphone jack often also doubles as its charging/syncing port using a special USB cable with an earphone plug on one end.

* !asset #22596099: In order: [[ipod shuffle 1g|1G]], [[ipod shuffle 2g|2G]], 3G, [[ipod shuffle 4g|4G]]

The [[iPod Nano 6G]] can sometimes be mistaken for an iPod Shuffle due to its tiny square shape. Unlike the Shuffle models, it has a screen and no buttons.

title: ipod_classic
body:
Refers to the original design of the [[iPod]] as it was first introduced in 2001. It has the large circular button interface which eventually developed into the Click Wheel which can be used for convenient scrolling. Although it boasts the largest storage for any [[digital media player]] (up to 160 GB), the eventual shortage of replacement parts and decreasing demand (no thanks to the easier usability of the touchscreen iPods: [[ipod Touch|Touch]] and [[ipod nano 6g|sixth]] and [[ipod nano 7g|seventh]] generation [[ipod nano|Nanos]]) led to its discontinuation.

!asset #22596031: In order: [[ipod classic 1g|1G]]/2G, [[ipod classic 3g|3G]], 4G, iPod Photo, 5G, 6G

There is much less visual difference between the generations, so most of the models are not tagged.

Unlike the other iterations, the Classic models only come in black and silver.

title: gokuhara_gonta
body:
[i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i] character.

The Ultimate Entomologist. As a child, he had gotten lost in the woods and stayed there ever since, being raised instead by the creatures of the forest. His love of bugs comes from the time he spent with them in the woods, and he hates those who think lowly of them. Because he had been disconnected from civilization for so long until high school, he is trying to keep up and make himself a perfect gentleman.

He is a big man with [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]] and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]]. His [[school uniform]] consists of a matching brown [[blazer]] and pants, over which he slings an [[bug cage]] over. Has [[red eyes]] and [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]]. Due to his forest upbringing, he tends to go [[barefoot]].

title: ipod_nano_7g
body:
The final iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2012 in a wide color range, and having even more colors added in 2015. It returns to the tall rectangular shape but still omits the click wheel, leaving only a touch screen interface and a home button.

It runs on a slightly more advanced operating system that is separate from [[iOS (os)|]] despite a similar appearance.

title: mighty_morphin_power_rangers
body:
The first series in Saban's [[Power Rangers]] franchise. Largely adapts stock footage from [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]] (along with newly filmed footage, often referred to as "Zyu2":[https://www.grnrngr.com/zyu2/]), with elements from [[Gosei Sentai Dairanger]] and [[Ninja Sentai Kakuranger]] being used for the second and third seasons respectively. The third season would also feature a crossover with [[Saban's Masked Rider]], serving as a quasi-backdoor pilot crossover for that show. 

[[Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers]], which used footage from Ninja Sentai Kakuranger along with newly filmed footage, followed after its third season, and directly continues from its events; as a result, it is officially considered 'Season 3.5', with [[Power Rangers Zeo]] being the first full series after Mighty Morphin and Alien Rangers.

Alongside the Zyuranger and Kakuranger suits used, it also debuted the first original Ranger suits in the form of the Dark Rangers from the second season and the Ninja Rangers from the third, the latter based on the costumes used for the Ninjetti-powered Rangers in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie|The Movie]].

title: ipod_nano_6g
body:
The sixth iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2010. It is the most radically different model in the series, having no click wheel at all and instead only a touch screen, as well as being a small square shape similar to that of the [[iPod Shuffle 4G]].

It comes in silver, dark grey, blue, green, orange, pink, and red.

title: ipod_nano_5g
body:
The fifth iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2009. It looks very similar to the [[iPod Nano 4G]] and retains all of its color variants, though slightly less saturated.

It also has a larger screen and has a metallic/glossy finish.

* !post #342239

title: ipod_nano_4g
body:
The fourth iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2008 with the widest color selection yet, adding purple, orange and yellow to the previously established lineup.

It returns to the longer design, but this time it is curved. It has a more matte finish and a slightly shorter screen than the [[iPod Nano 5G]].

Additionally, the silver model's control wheel is now a dark gray.

* !post #331449

It comes in silver, green, blue, black, and pink, as well as the website-exclusive red.

title: ipod_nano_2g
body:
The second iteration of the [[iPod Nano]], released in 2006. Comes in a wider range of colors, including silver, green, blue, pink, and black. An additional red color was exclusively sold on Apple's website.

It has a more rectangular shape than the previous model with sharper edges. Additionally, the wheel on the silver model is now white instead of a darker gray.

It has rounder edges than the [[iPod Nano 2G]], and the silver model's click wheel is darker rather than lighter.

title: bullying
body:
The act of using the force or coercion to [[abuse]] or intimidate others. It can include verbal harassment or threat, physical or sexual assault or coercion and may be directed repeatedly towards particular victims, perhaps on grounds of race, religion, gender, sexuality, or ability.

Oftentimes, the "bully" (the person who partake in bullying) aims to prove their perceived superiority against the victim. Meanwhile, the typical target of bullying are those who were perceived to be weak or has certain odd traits, such as the stereotypical nerd. 

Some methods of bullying include forcefully [[cutting hair]], [[graffiti]], [[humiliation]], [[memorial on desk]], [[grabbing another's hair]], simply [[punching]]/[[kicking]]/[[slapping]] the target, etc.

h4. See Also

* [[abuse]]
* [[teasing]]
* [[prank]]
* [[suicide]]

title: ipod_mini
body:
A short-lived [[iPod]] model that is smaller than the [[iPod Classic]] but larger than the [[iPod Nano]]. There is a 2004 version and a 2005 version, but they are largely the same visually.

It has a much simpler screen and comes in silver, blue, green, pink and gold.

title: ipod_nano
body:
A smaller-sized version of the [[iPod]], often with less storage space (at least 4 to 8 GB) and smaller, but still colorful screen. It had undergone changes over the years. The first five generations included the Click Wheel from the [[iPod Classic]]. The last two generations have touchscreen interfaces instead.

!asset #22596034: In order: [[iPod Mini]] (not a Nano), [[ipod nano 1g|1G]], [[ipod nano 2g|2G]], [[ipod nano 3g|3G]], [[ipod nano 4g|4G]], [[ipod nano 5g|5G]], [[ipod nano 6g|6G]], [[ipod nano 7g|7G]]

title: billy_kane
body:
One of the minor villains in the [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series. His last name is properly pronounced "Kahn".

Billy wields a [[bo staff]] that he can modularly detatch into a [[three section staff]]. He can also wreath his staff in [[fire]].

Hailing from England, Billy is [[Geese Howard]]'s right-hand man. As of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], following the death of Geese twelve years earlier, Billy is the new leader of his syndicate, the Howard Connection. [[Lilly Kane]] is his innocent little sister.

Billy is cited as the direct inspiration for [[Guilty Gear]]'s [[Axl Low]].

h4. See also

* [[Pretty Billy Kane]]

title: wonder_of_u
body:
Wonder of U is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [spoilers] [[Tooru (jojolion)|]], [/spoilers] featured in the eighth part of the [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] series, [[JoJolion]].
[spoilers]It is a sentient [[Stand (jojo)|]]  that acts as the director of TG University Hospital using the name [[Akefu Satoru]], impersonating the identity of a retired medical professional. It is capable of causing a calamity to anyone who pursues or works against it or its user. [/spoilers] 

Wonder of U is an artificial [[humanoid robot|humanoid]] [[Stand (jojo)|]] with robotic features. It has a large torso but thin, tubular arms, with several articulations on its arms and waist. 

It wears a dark-colored [[bowler hat]] and a black suit, along with a lightly colored scarf with a pattern of irregular dash-shaped slits cut into it. It also wears dress shoes and uses a [[cane]] to walk.

Once it is revealed that [spoilers][[Akefu Satoru]] and[/spoilers] Wonder of U are the same entity, Wonder of U keeps [spoilers] [[Akefu Satoru]]'s outfit and accessories. However, it displays the hospital director's face less often to [[Mamezuku Rai]] and [[Higashikata Josuke (jojolion)|]].[/spoilers]

title: vox_reaper
body: Introduced in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Vox Reaper is the successor to the late [[Grant (SNK)|Grant]]. Trained in his master's style of Dark Karate, Vox serves as the new enforcer of [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]].

title: mr_big_(snk)
body:
A villain in [[SNK]]'s [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series of video games. The original boss of the South Town underworld, before a young [[Geese Howard]] swooped in and took over. Serving as Geese's second for a time, Mr. Big was the mastermind behind the kidnapping of [[Yuri Sakazaki]] in AoF. After [[Ryou Sakazaki|Ryo Sakazaki]] and [[Robert Garcia]] ran Geese out of town, Mr. Big disappeared for a time, with no love lost for Geese. In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], twelve years after Geese's death by [[Terry Bogard]], Mr. Big returns to reassert himself as the OG of South Town. He secretly worked as part of a collaboration with [[Billy Kane]] and [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]] to protect Marie Heinlein, sister of Kain and mother of Geese's bastard son [[Rock Howard]].

In the King of Fighters continuity, Mr. Big again served as Geese's lackey before eventually turning on him, and he and Geese are in the midst of a gang war in South Town.

title: powdered_wig
body: A type of [[wig]] worn mostly by men in the 18th century which was "powdered" to give it a bright white hue. Formal wear and often used by politicians and aristocrats.

title: salome_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A biblical figure who was the daughter of Herod II and Herodias. At a grand banquet, and at her mother's behest, Salome made a request to Herod Antipas; the head of John the Baptist given to her on a platter, which was thus brought to her.

In Fate/Grand Order, she is depicted as a somewhat [[yandere]] woman, and her dialogue reveals that she fell in love with John the Baptist, which she says was the reason for her request to "stay" together with him. [spoiler]In fact, the skull that she wields is actually of John the Baptist's with his soul still inside. John treated himself as a half-reluctant mentor who seems to be used to Salome's antics.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Simosi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]]

title: fatal_fury:_city_of_the_wolves
body:
The tenth installment of the [[Fatal Fury]] series, the seventh canon entry in the series, and the second game in the series after the timeskip introduced in [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. The game released April 24, 2025. City of the Wolves is the first Fatal Fury game in over 25 years, after Garou: Mark of the Wolves released in 1999. The title acknowledges both the western (Fatal Fury) and Japanese (餓狼伝説 "Garou Densetsu") names of the franchise.

The story takes place in ~2008, two years after the events of Garou:MotW - thus twelve years after the death of [[Geese Howard]], covering the events of the second running of the King of Fighters: Maximum Mayhem tournament in South Town and its prize of "Geese's legacy" as the reward.

h4. Characters

h5. Returning characters

* [[Rock Howard]]
* [[Terry Bogard]]
* [[Futaba Hotaru]]
* [[Tizoc (snk)|Tizoc/Griffon Mask]]
* [[Marco Rodrigues]]

title: rock_howard
body:
Biological son of [[Geese Howard]], adopted son of [[Terry Bogard]], Rock Howard is the protagonist of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]] and [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], while also making a number of appearances in [[The King of Fighters]].

Following Geese's death after falling from his tower, Terry took a young Rock under his wing as the boy's guardian. Rock took moves from both of his fathers, learning moves from Terry and inheriting some of Geese's trademark techniques. He has business with [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]], the new big boss of South Town's underworld and the man who not only claims to be Rock's uncle, but also that the late Marie Heinlein - Rock's mother and Kain's sister - is alive. In FF:CotW, Rock finally reunites with his mother Marie and chooses to travel and find his own path, just like Terry.

In FF:CotW, an alternate unplayable boss version of Rock known as [b]Fallen Rock[/b] is manifested by the influence of the Jin scrolls, a ruthless dark reflection and personification of his "evil blood" who believes the original Rock to be a failure. Once defeated, the Jin scrolls release their hold on Rock, and he returns to normal.

Fans often pair him with [[Type-Moon]]'s [[Arima Miyako]] in [[M.U.G.E.N]] and other fan works since they are both adoptees of their respective families (Rock being the Bogards, Miyako being the Tohno).

title: grant_(snk)
body:
Sub-boss of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. His most famous feature is his red horned [[mask]].

Formerly known as Abel, Grant was the brother and chief enforcer of main boss [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]] and master of the devastating occult martial art Dark Karate. After taking a bullet to protect Kain, Grant sat at death's door for years and sought a worthy battle to end his life. Grant ultimately lost his final battle - presumably to [[Terry Bogard]] - and presumably succumbed to his wounds.

In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Grant is succeeded by his disciple, [[Vox Reaper]], though Grant himself still lives.

title: andy_bogard
body:
A main character of [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series, and [[brothers|younger brother]] to [[Terry Bogard]]. He is one of the co-protagonists of the greater Fatal Fury series alongside Terry and his best friend [[Joe Higashi]].

Andy is commonly seen wearing some version of a ninja oufit; he typically wears a white shinobi shozoko with red [[gloves]] and [[belt]]. His outfit mostly sports a [[fire]] design. He has [[blue eyes]], and [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] that is occasionally tied in a [[ponytail]] but is normally [[hair down|worn down]]. In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Andy cuts his hair [[short hair|short]], just like his brother.

Andy is a [[ninja]], trained from a young age in Koppo, Hakkyokuseiken, and Shiranui-ryuu Ninjutsu alongside native heir to the style [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]], in order to work alongside his brother Terry to avenge the death of their father Jeff Bogard at the hands of South Town's crime lord [[Geese Howard]]. Compared to laid-back Terry and jokester Joe, Andy is the serious straight man of the trio, honing his skill to a razor's edge with a killer instinct that lets him defeat foes that even give Terry and Joe a hard time. His singular blind spot is his brother Terry, whom he treats as a rival; he gets too excited fighting him and tends to lose against him.

Mai is Andy's lover and, at least as of FF:CotW, is engaged to her. Historically, Mai tended to move the relationship a bit too quickly for Andy's liking, a point played for humor.

As of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], he and Mai are training a young Shiranui-ryuu disciple, [[Hokutomaru]].

title: nanashi_mumei_(emo)
body:
The 4th and final [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Nanashi Mumei]]. It has an [[emo fashion|emo motif]] (translated into Japanese as punk rock).

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[lace-trimmed choker]] with a [[heart choker|heart]] [[pendant choker|pendant]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[print shirt|print]] [[t-shirt]] featuring a variation of her infamous [[Nightmare (nanashi mumei)|"Nightmare" painting]] with a [[torn sweater|torn]] [[black sweater|black]] and [[red sweater|red]] [[striped sweater]] [[sweater under shirt|underneath]], giving her [[short over long sleeves]], an owl [[necklace]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] [[half-skirt|half]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[black belt]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[mismatched legwear]] (a [[single kneehigh|single]] [[black socks|black]] [[fishnet socks|fishnet kneehigh]] with a [[white leg warmers|white]] [[leg warmers|leg warmer]] on her right leg and a [[black leg warmers|black leg warmer]] on her left, both depicting her [[mascot]] [[Friend (nanashi_mumei)|]]) and [[black boots|black]] [[platform boots]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume, both styles are tied with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s, [[long bangs|long]] [[asymmetrical bangs]], [[hair over one eye|over her right eye]] and a [[huge ahoge]]:
* [[Long hair|Long]] [[brown hair]] done in a [[one side up]]
* [[Medium hair]] done in [[twintails]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7259920: Profile (1)
* !post #7259985: Profile (2)

title: ultraman_vs._kamen_rider
body:
A retrospective [[crossover]] special of the [[Ultra Series]] and [[Kamen Rider]], released in 1993.

This special was made to commemorate the 25th and 20th anniversaries of both franchises respectively, featuring clips from the various series from over the years, interviews with two of the stars, and finally a team-up between [[Tsuburaya Productions]]' [[Ultraman]] and Toei Company's Kamen Rider.

body: Before the crash, [[Curly (mouthwashing)|]] was an average-built man with [[blue eyes]], light stubble, and [[curly hair|curly]] [[blonde hair]] formed into a middle part. He wore [[brown boots]] and Pony Express coveralls ([[blue jacket]] and [[blue pants]]) over a [[yellow shirt]].

title: snow_white_(disney)
body:
Snow White is a fictional character and a main character from [[Disney|Walt Disney Productions]]' first animated feature film [[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]] (1937). The character of [[Snow White (grimm)|]] was derived from a fairy tale known from many countries in Europe with the best-known version being the 1812 tale collected by the [[grimm's fairy tales|Brothers Grimm]].

h4. See also

* [[Disney]]
* [[Snow White]]

title: ultraman_nice_(series)
body:
A series of 40 one-minute commercials advertising the [[Ultra Series]] merchandise from [[Bandai]]. Stars the titular [[Ultraman Nice]].

This series was produced in between [[Ultraman Gaia (series)|]] and [[Ultraman Cosmos (series)|]]. It was aired during re-runs of [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]] in 1999.

The series would return in 2012, with the ULTRA-EG toyline, with the toys demonstrated by the mysterious [[Dr. E.G.]], who looks suspiciously like Nice...

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_Nice

title: liquid_umbrella
body: An [[umbrella]] that has a canopy which is formed out of a liquid, likely [[water]]. Can also apply to a character using [[hydrokinesis]] to form an umbrella or umbrella-like effect.

title: ultraman_zearth_(series)
body:
A film series in the long-running [[Ultra Series]], consisting of two movies, [i]Ultraman Zearth[/i], and [i]Ultraman Zearth 2: Superhuman War: Light and Shadow[/i]. Both movies were released in 1996 and 1997, respectively. The movies serve as a [[parody]]/spoof of the Ultra Series, in general.

It also features product placement from the [[Idemitsu (gas station)|]] petroleum company, in which the character of [[Ultraman Zearth]] is created to advertise for. Zearth would be succeeded in this role in 2007 by the Ultra Idemitsujin, who would appear exclusively in Idemitsu commercials, consisting of [[Ultraman Hotto]], [[Ultraman Motto|Motto]], and [[Ultraman Kitto|Kitto]], with their designs drawing from Zearth's. As a result, they count under Zearth's copyright tag.

h4. External links

title: eye_slugger
body:
[[Ultraseven]]'s signature weapon. A [[boomerang]]-like projectile, which functions similarly to the [[Ultra Slash]].

His son, [[Ultraman Zero]], wields two Sluggers, also known as the Zero Sluggers. [[Ultraman Omega]] wields an Eye Slugger of his own, known as the Omega Slugger.

title: ultraman_neos_(series)
body:
An installment of the long-running [[Ultra Series]]. Stars the titular [[Ultraman Neos]], with [[Ultraseven 21]] appearing as a secondary Ultraman.

It was originally going to be produced as a TV series in 1995, but it was shelved in favor of [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]]. The project was eventually dusted off and turned into a direct-to-video series in 2000, with 12 episodes produced, in total, earning it the position of the 15th installment in the franchise. Due to the 1995 pilot, both Neos and Seven 21 are considered by Tsuburaya to be earlier Ultramen than not just [[Ultraman Tiga]], but [[Ultraman Zearth]] too.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_Neos

title: sialim_eltnam_re-atlasia
body:
A minor character in [[Fate/EXTRA]].

Sialim Eltnam Re-Atlasia is the last alchemist of the Atlas institute in the world of EXTRA. She has a twin [[Sion Eltnam (type-moon)|elder sister]] who died at birth. As an Atlasian alchemist she was devoted only to her own research, her goal is to avoid the future of destruction. Essentially, this means that it's okay for humanity to change or decline as a species if it means surviving. She created the homunculus known as [[Rani VIII]] with the intention to see if it was possible for not just alchemists but for humanity to continue existing in the cyber world, which would mean having to give up their physical bodies. After sending Rani to the moon, she succumbed to a terminal disease and passed away in a month.

h4. Appearance
* !post #2122544

h4. See also

* "Type-Moon wikia entry":http://typemoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sialim_Eltnam_Re-Atlasia#Sialim_Eltnam_Re-Atlasia
other_names: シアリム・エルトナム・レイアトラシア

This film is a international co-production between [[Tsuburaya Productions]] and [[Hanna-Barbera]], creators of [[Tom and Jerry|Tom & Jerry]] and [[Scooby-Doo|Scooby-Doo!]], with animation provided by Ashi Productions, the studio behind [[Mahou no Princess Minky Momo]].

body:

A [[dark skin]]ned girl with light blue hair, [[glasses]] and a [[bindi]], she typically wears a lab coat over a white shirt, or the Tsukimihara navy blue school uniform. title: chen_gong_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The former advisor of Cao Cao before defecting to become [[Lu Bu (fate)|]]'s advisor. Bears a heavy physical resemblance to [[Rani VIII]].

He cameoed in [[Fate/Extella]] before appearing as an NPC in the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. He was then introduced as a playable servant in the 5th anniversary.

After his debut, he gained a memetic status thanks to his Noble Phantasm that is very similar to [[Arash (fate)|]]'s, except he sacrifices his teammates instead of himself as a demerit. Because of this, he is frequently paired with other servants that can further boost his attack, usually [[Artoria Caster (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]

[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of [[Julius Caesar]], the dictator of Rome and a general who made a name for himself in the Gallic Wars and the Britannia Expedition and his contribution to the rise of what would have later become the Roman Empire.

Caesar is depicted as being [[fat]] in-game, with him claiming it to be the result of him being "not properly summoned" and thus not at his peak performance, though his extremely gluttonous diet would seem to suggest otherwise. title: tem_ray's_circuit
body:
A fictional electronic device from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

It is a technological gadget created by [[Tem Ray]] intended to enhance the abilities of any [[mobile suit]]. [spoilers]It does not work properly, as Tem was already brain damaged while developing it.[/spoilers] It is the subject of many memes in Japan, and is often featured as an optional part in the [[Super Robot Wars]] series where equipping it to a unit causes mostly detrimental effects.

title: ultra_galaxy_(series)
body:
A sub-series in the long-running [[Ultra Series]], which began in 2007. Has an eye towards fan service of some capacity, and elements from it often cross over into and linking together main installments in the franchise. The main domain of [[Ultraman Zero]], who serves as the sub-series' perennial protagonist, who would also host [i]Ultraman Retsuden[/i] and [i]Shin Ultraman Retsuden[/i] from 2011 to 2016 (and these would be followed up by [i]Ultraman Zero: The Chronicle[/i] from 2017, which recounts the main entries he had appeared in, all while still hosting, [i]Ultraman Chronicle Zero & Geed[/i] from 2020, which follows it up while being hosted by Asakura Riku, [i]Ultraman Chronicle Z: Heroes' Odyssey[/i] from 2021, and [i]Ultraman New Generation Stars[/i] from 2023 onward).

The sub-series can be subdivided into two main eras; the first era which sees the rise of the Reionics, with [[Reiblood Seijin]] and [[Ultraman Belial]] acting as its main antagonists, and the second era which sees a greater focus on multiversal stories, culminating in the emergence of the Absolutians as its main antagonists.

h4. Titles

h5. Reiblood Era

* [[Ultra Galaxy Mega Dai-Kaijuu Battle]] (2007-2009)
** [i]Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Adventure[/i] (2008-2010)
* [[Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu The Movie]] (2009)
* [[Ultraman Zero vs. Darklops Zero]] (2010)
* [[Ultraman Zero The Movie Choukessen! Belial Ginga Teikoku]] (2010)

h5. Multiversal Era

* [i]Killer the Beatstar[/i] (2011)
* [[Ultraman Saga (movie)|]] (2012)
* [i]Ultra Zero Fight[/i] (2012-2013)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: New Generation Heroes]] (2019)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Absolute Conspiracy]] (2020-2021)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Destined Crossroad]] (2021-2022)
** [i]Ultraman Regulos: First Mission[/i] (2022)
** [i]Ultraman Regulos[/i] (2023)

h4. See also

* [[Ultraman Geed (series)|]] - first installment spinning off from Ultra Galaxy, with the protagonist being the son of Belial
* [[Ultraman Z (series)|]] - second installment spinning off, with the protagonist being trained by Zero

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_Galaxy_Fight

title: terry_bogard
body:
Main character of the [[Fatal Fury]] series and a regular in [[The King of Fighters]]. His [i]nom de guerre[/i] is the "(Legendary) Hungry Wolf".

Terry is an American street fighter, trained in Hakkyokuseiken and a mish-mash of various martial arts. He is the [[brothers|elder brother]] to [[Andy Bogard]] and friends with [[Joe Higashi]], [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]], and [[Blue Mary]] among many others, mortal enemy of [[Geese Howard]] - the South Town crime lord who murdered his and Andy's father Jeff Bogard, and adoptive father and mentor to Geese's bastard son [[Rock Howard]]. He is one of the biggest folk heroes of South Town, a fictional coastal American metropolis inspired by Miami, Florida.

Terry is one of [[SNK]]'s chief ambassadors, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions on top of being an all-around very popular character and important to the landscape of video games. For example, he is commonly cited as the primary inspiration for [[Guilty Gear]]'s [[Sol Badguy]]. He achieved his [[meme|memetic]] status in part through his "engrish" quotes said during gameplay.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3618604: Classic Terry
* !post #6191180: Time-skip Terry
* !post #3211344: [[SNK Heroines: Tag Team Frenzy|Heroine]] Terry

He mostly wears a red leather [[vest]] that has a [[star (symbol)|]] on the back, a [[baseball cap]] that matches his vest with the words [[fatal fury cap|Fatal Fury]] on it, a white T-shirt (later replaced by a [[tank top]] of the same color), blue [[jeans]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]], and [[fingerless gloves]]. His [[blonde hair]] is mainly done in a [[ponytail]].

From [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]] onward, Terry [[short hair|cut his hair]] and [[hair down|wears it down]] without his cap, and he pairs a brown [[bomber jacket]] and loafers with his jeans and gloves.

h4. Known moves

* [[Burn Knuckle]]
* [[Buster Wolf]]
* [[Power Geyser]]
* [[Power Wave]]
* [[Rising Tackle]]

title: jodio_joestar
body:
Jodio Joestar (ジョディオ・ジョースター, Jodio Jōsutā) is the main protagonist of the ninth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[The JOJOLands]], and the ninth JoJo of the series.
Jodio is a small-time gangster with his older brother [[Dragona Joestar]] and his mother [[Barbara Ann Joestar]]. He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user who wields [[November Rain (stand)|]], allowing him to create localized drops of rain that can crush his opponents.
 Jodio is a 15-year-old boy. He has light skin and light-colored hair with [[long bangs]] partially obscuring both of his eyes and an undercut at the back. His hair is asymmetrical, as the right [[side braided]] with a [[star hair ornament]] [[hairclip]] attached, and the left side is cut just below his eye. He wears a large "JO" shaped [[earrings|earring]] that hangs from his left ear. As a descendant of the Joestar family, Jodio has the [[Joestar birthmark| Star Birthmark]] on his left shoulder.
His outfit consists of a light [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] shirt under dark [[hooded overalls]] with a [[wings ornament|winged]] [[heart emblem]] at the center of the chest. The emblem is marked by an hourglass symbol with both triangles split into a dark and a bright half, and the shirt has been shown to have the word "NOVEMBER" written on the front collar. The overalls bears a strong resemblance to a life preserver, having a belt fastened around the chest under the heart emblem, sporting rigid light-colored [[shoulder pads]], and exposing most of Jodio's back. The overalls are also fastened to the shirt by two buttons at the back of the waist. The overalls' pantlegs are split under the knee, giving them a similar appearance to [[bell-bottoms]], both also studded in a vertical column besides the slit.
He also has [[armbands]] shaped like two triangles wrapped around each bicep and [[fingerless gloves]] or [[bridal gauntlets]]. Jodio wears dark plain dress shoes.
As an eleven year old, Jodio wore almost the exact same style of clothing. Rather than the heart emblem, his hoodie had "JO" written in large centered letters with the top line of the J being elongated.
other_names: ジョディオ・ジョースター

title: falcon_punch
body:
The signature move of [[Captain Falcon]], which consists of winding up a [[punching|punch]], usually with one's fist covered in [[fire|flames]], and then throwing the mighty blow with a [[falcon]] made of fire erupting from that hand.

This special move does not exist in the [[F-ZERO]] series and first appeared in [[Super Smash Bros.]]
[spoiler]In the final episode of [[F-ZERO Falcon Densetsu]], it was used to deliver the finishing blow to [[Black Shadow]].
At that time, there was no flame in the form of a falcon, but instead blue lightning was produced.[/spoiler]

body:

Also serves as a sequel series to [[Ultraman Trigger (series)|]], being set in the same universe as its predecessor, much like how Dyna is a direct sequel to [[ultraman tiga (series)|Tiga]].

body:

It's also the first Ultra series to integrate collectables in the show proper, much like its [[kamen rider|contem]][[super sentai|poraries]]. In this case, Spark Dolls.

title: higashikata_josuke_(jojolion)
body:
Josuke Higashikata (東方 定助, Higashikata Jōsuke) is the main protagonist of the eighth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[JoJolion]], and the eighth JoJo of the series.

Wears a [[dixie cup hat]] and sailor clothes, [[sneakers]], [[peace symbol]] and [[anchor print]] on shirt and has a distinct gap in his teeth. He has [[Joestar birthmark]], [spoilers]which he received from [[Kira Yoshikage (JoJolion) | Kira Yoshikage]][/spoilers].
[spoiler]
He is a fusion of [[Kira Yoshikage (JoJolion) | Kira Yoshikage]] and [[Kujo Josefumi]]. [/spoilers]

Josuke is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user and retains an upgraded version of  [[Soft & Wet]].

title: 10t_(boku_no_hero_academia)
body:
Character created by [[Horie Ryuu]].

Her hero name is "Tetona" (meaning "busty" or "big-tittied" in Spanish.).  Her real name is unknown.
Her costume is purple in colour and features an [[eye mask]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[highleg leotard]] with ‘10t’ written on the chest and [[thighhighs]].

Her breasts seem to change size, usually [[large breasts|large]], but [[breast expansion|expand]] to [[gigantic breasts|gigantic size]] when she acts as a hero.  Her breasts, which are said to weigh up to 10 tonnes, can be used as a weapon to crush villains.

title: kamisama_minarai:_himitsu_no_cocotama
body:
"Kamisama Minarai: Himitsu no Cocotama (Hepburn: Kamisama minarai Himitsu no Kokotama, "Cocotama: Secret Apprentice Gods") is a fantasy comedy anime series produced by OLM, Inc., based on the Cocotama House Series of toys created by Bandai. The series is directed by Norio Nitta and written by Michihiro Tsuchiya (Mirmo De Pon!, PriPara, Cross Game) with character designs by Shinobu Ookawa. The series began airing on all TXN stations in Japan on October 1, 2015, replacing Tamagotchi! on its initial timeslot. The series uses a few elements from Shinto Animism, regarding the Cocotamas." [1]

h4. Characters 

* [[Yotsuba Kokoro]]
* [[Yotsuba Misato]]
* [[Hoshino Hina]]

h4. Links

* [1] Wikipedia entry - "English":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamisama_Minarai:_Himitsu_no_Cocotama | "Japanese":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%8B%E3%81%BF%E3%81%95%E3%81%BE%E3%81%BF%E3%81%AA%E3%82%89%E3%81%84_%E3%83%92%E3%83%9F%E3%83%84%E3%81%AE%E3%81%93%E3%81%93%E3%81%9F%E3%81%BE

title: ultraman_tiga_(series)
body:
The 12th installment of the long-running [[Ultra Series]], and the first entry in the Heisei era.

It introduces the concept of a "type-changing" Ultraman, as in the titular [[ultraman tiga|Ultra]] character changes forms/colors, depending on the battle.

[spoiler]
The show also serves as a 30th anniversary celebration of the franchise, as seen in Episode 49, aptly titled, "The Ultra Star".
[/spoiler]

In 2002, the show was dubbed in English by [[4Kids|4Kids Entertainment]], making it one of the few Ultra series dubbed in the US. The dub however, proved to be unpopular with fans, ultimately causing 4Kids to drop the show halfway through, instead opting to release an uncut, subtitled version of the series on DVD, courtesy of [[Funimation]].

h4. See also

* [[Ultraman Tiga: The Final Odyssey]]
* [[Global Unlimited Task Squad uniform]]

h4. External links

* Officially streaming on YouTube thru the TokuSHOUTsu channel (episode 1 only): "Subbed":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q2UEHi0hPSE]*
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_Tiga
<tn>Original theme song "Take Me Higher" not included.</tn>

title: headband
body:
A strap [b]worn across the forehead[/b], such as a sweatband, a strip of cloth worn during martial arts or athletic events, or a piece of ninja armor (however apocryphal). While a headband may be used to keep hair out of the eyes, it is usually worn under at least part of the hair. Headbands often end with a long tail trailing behind the head where they are tied. 

For a band [b]worn over the top of the head[/b], that is principally used to maintain a hair style, see [[hairband]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8761939
* !post #4442577
* !post #5612240

title: red_vs_blue
body:
An animated web series created by [[RoosterTeeth]] and its first show. Notable for its use of machinima style where prerecorded voices were dub over videogame footage. Loosely set in the [[Halo (series)|]] universe, the series follows an ongoing training war exercise between two teams of Spartans, Red Team and Blue Team, while also parodying FPS videogames, military life and Sci-Fi movies. 

At the beginning, the series used the Halo engine from the Halo games to animate the show before later seasons switched to Unreal Engine 4. Since its beginning from 2003 and ending in 2024, Red Vs Blue had over 19 seasons, 7 mini-series and one movie.

title: mori_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A Nikke from Incubator, an auxiliary squad operating under Missilis.

Originally manufactured as something ordinary, her path to survival has been filled with hardship and unexpected turns—even facing the threat of being discarded.

Despite this, her desire to survive remains incredibly strong. She believes that life is still worth clinging to, even if it means living in abject poverty and misery. She’s one of the Nikkes full of stories.

h4. Official Art
* !post #9180145: Default

title: old_tales_(nikke)
body:
A squad in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. An elite fighting force consisting of [[Cinderella (nikke)|]], [[Red shoes (nikke)|]], [[Little Mermaid (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]] and [[Gretel (nikke)|]]. 

The second-generation grimms models created by [[Abe (nikke)|]]; designed to surpass the [[Goddess (nikke)|Goddess Squad]].

Their mission was to meet with their predecessors to help end the Rapture threat once and for all.
At least... That's how it was supposed to be...

title: dr._wario
body:
[[Wario]] as a [[doctor]] in the [[Warioware|WarioWare, Inc.: Mega Microgame$!]] minigame or [[Dr. Mario World]]. 

In Dr. Mario World he is dressed with a [[stethoscope]] [[stethoscope_around_neck |around his neck]] and a [[head mirror]], [[purple coat]], [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], [[yellow necktie]] with a "W" and [[purple overalls]].

title: bunny_mario
body: [[Mario]] gaining [[rabbit ears|bunny ears]] on his hat as makeshift wings, granting him the ability to greatly slow his descent while falling when using the [[Carrot (mario)|]], debuting in [i][[Super Mario Land 2|Super Mario Land 2: 6 Golden Coins]][/i].

title: double_mario
body: [[Mario]] gaining [[clone|multiple copies of himself]] when using the [[Double Cherry]], debuting in [i][[Super Mario 3D World]][/i].

title: curly_(post-crash)
body: After the crash, [[Curly (mouthwashing)|]] is nearly unrecognizable; his hair, lips, and the majority of his features are burned away. He is wrapped in [[bandages]], while still exposing subcutaneous flesh and muscle. He has no hands and feet and wears a hospital gown, which is [[blood on clothes|heavily blood-soaked]]. His most prominent feature are his fully exposed mouth and blue eyeball, which are his only facial features not covered by bandages.

title: mega_mario
body:
[[Mario]] growing in size, allowing him to squish or destroy anything in his path.

Though growing in size has been a part of the franchise and many of it's games since it's inception, this tag is referring to when using a [[Mega Mushroom]] that debuted in [[New Super Mario Bros.]]

title: p_flying_squirrel_mario
body: [[Mario]] wearing an enhanced version of the [[flying_squirrel_mario|Flying Squirrel power up]] that gives him the ability to glide and perform jumps indefinitely without landing when using the P-Acorn, debuting in [i][[New Super Mario Bros. U]][/i].

title: wing_mario
body: [[Mario]] gaining [[wings]] on his hat granting him the ability to fly when wearing the [[Wing Cap]], debuting in [i][[Super Mario 64]][/i].

title: vanish_mario
body: [[Mario]] becoming [[invisible]] when wearing the Vanish Cap, debuting in [i][[Super Mario 64]][/i].

title: weird_mario
body: [[Mario]] with elongated limbs and proportions when using the Weird Mushroom, giving him a higher jump and less traction (similar to [[Luigi]]'s physics in some games). Debuted in [i][[Super Mario Maker]][/i].

title: white_tanooki_mario
body:
[[Mario]] wearing a powered up version of the [[Tanuki Mario|Tanuki Suit]] when using the Invincibility Leaf, debuting in [i][[Super Mario 3d Land]][/i] & [i][[Super Mario 3d World]][/i]. On top of the tanuki abilities, he's also given permanent invincibility, 

In this form, he wears a [[white hood]], [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[raccoon ears]], and a [[fake tail|fake]] [[raccoon tail]].

title: ok_sign_over_eye
body:
Holding an [[ok sign]] over the eye, with the eye peeking out of the opening.

May overlap with [[hand glasses]].

title: hand_glasses
body:
Finger(s) encircling the eye(s). Has at a minimum the thumb and index finger encircling an eye, resembling the lens of glasses. Eye(s) may not be entirely surrounded (thumb and forefinger may not touch).
Variations may include the entire hand encircling an eye, two eyes being encircled, or both. 

May overlap with [[ok sign over eye]].

h4. See also
* [[hand up]]
* [[hands up]]

title: curly_(mouthwashing)
body:
Curly is the original captain of the Tulpar, prior to the crash and [[Jimmy (mouthwashing)|]] taking over. He was at the top of the ship's command chain and was primarily in charge of navigation.

[[curly_(pre-crash)|Before the crash]], Curly was an average-built man with [[blue eyes]], light stubble, and [[curly hair| curly]] [[blonde hair]] formed into a middle part. He wore [[brown boots]] and Pony Express coveralls ([[blue jacket]] and [[blue pants]]) over a [[yellow shirt]].

[[curly_(post-crash)|After the crash]], he is nearly unrecognizable; his hair, lips, and the majority of his features are burned away. He is wrapped in [[bandages]], while still exposing subcutaneous flesh and muscle. He has no hands and feet and wears a hospital gown, which is [[blood on clothes|heavily blood-soaked]]. His most prominent feature are his fully exposed mouth and eyeball, which are his only facial features not covered by bandages.

title: distorted_halo
body:
Not to be confused with [[glitched halo]], which is not used to represent sensations and is a separate type of halo rather than a distortion of the classic halo.

Halo that differs from the standard one by the presence of interference or distortion. Caused by strong sensations that the characters experience. An artistic technique used by [[Blue Archive]] artists to depict [[orgasm]] commonly depicted in sex scenes.

Halo is also officially a representation of consciousness, and its distortion may indicate that the character is beginning to lose consciousness.

Types of distortion in descending order:
1. Post #7905335 - [b]Interference[/b]
2. Post #7927660 - [b]Deformation[/b]
3. Post #6782418 - [b][[faded halo|Fading]][/b]
4. Post #7944266 - [b]Wind[/b]

title: thundercats
body:
[i]Thunder...!! Thunder...!! Thunder...!!! THUNDERCATS....!!!! HOOOOOOO.....!!!!![/i] - Lion-O, Lord of the ThunderCats.

[i][b]ThunderCats[/b][/i] is an American [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] [[Furry]] animated television series that was produced by Rankin/Bass Productions debuting in 1985, based on the characters created by Tobin "Ted" Wolf. It was originally intended as an attempt to profit from the success of previous similar shows like [[Masters of the Universe]].

The series follows the adventures of a group of catlike humanoid aliens with super powers. 

The cartoon, for which Leonard Starr was the head writer, became extremely popular and lasted 4 seasons. The animation for the episodes is notable because it actually was provided by the Japanese studio Pacific Animation Corporation, later acquired in 1989 to form Walt Disney Animation Japan. Thus the animation was made in an 80s anime style.

The series was originally distributed by Rankin-Bass Productions' then-parent company Telepictures Corporation, which would later merge with Lorimar Productions in 1986. In 1989 Lorimar-Telepictures was purchased by Warner Bros, who has owned the rights for the series since then.

There were also several comic book series produced: A [[Marvel]] Comics' version (currently owned by Warner Bros. rival Disney), 1984 to 1988; and five series by Wildstorm, an imprint of DC Comics (Warner Bros.' corporate sibling), beginning in 2003. Items of clothing featuring the ThunderCats logo and DVD boxsets of the original series have enjoyed a resurgence in recent years as nostalgia for the former children's favorite has grown.

A remake of the original ThunderCats animated series was produced by Warner Bros. Animation and began airing on Cartoon Network from July 2011. Animation production was being done by Japanese animation company Studio 4°C. Despite an early positive response the new series was cancelled after only one season because of low ratings.

h4. Characters

* [[Lion-O]]

title: saber_lily
body:
A non-canonical alternate costume of [[Saber (fate)|]] playable in the [[Fate/Unlimited Codes]] fighting game for the PS2 based on [[Fate/stay night]]. She also appeared in the Type-Moon OVA [[Carnival Phantasm]], along with [[Phantas-Moon]], [[Magical Amber]], and [[Kaleido Ruby]]. 

She is basically [[Saber (fate)|]] as a [[magical girl]] with a strong [[lily (flower)|lily]] motif, though not in a literal sense.

As of the release of [[Fate/Grand Order]], she has gotten an official story, where she is Saber during her earlier days, still wielding [[Caliburn (fate)|]] and just beginning to walk the path of a king. She was still an inexperienced knight, looked  like an adorable lily, and her eyes brimmed with shining hope. To experience many things, she traveled the land and engaged in many adventures. The people she saved in his time came to call her in past of the Knight Princess, for her brilliance and beauty.

Saber Lily is treated as a separate character from Saber, so do not add the [[Saber (fate)|]] tag if she is by herself. It's only applicable if both characters are together in the image.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: prey_(predator)
body: Prey is a 2022 American science fiction action horror film, directed by Dan Trachtenberg and written by Patrick Aison. It is the fifth installment, and seventh overall including the crossover movies, of the [[Predator (series)|]]. The story takes place chronologically before the previous movies and serves as a prequel, as it is set in the Northern Great Plains in 1719. It stars Amber Midthunder, Dakota Beavers, Dane DiLiegro, Michelle Thrush, Stormee Kipp, Julian Black Antelope, and Bennett Taylor. The story revolves around a young Comanche woman, Naru, who is striving to prove herself as a hunter. She finds herself having to protect her people from a vicious, humanoid alien that hunts humans for sport, as well as from French fur traders who are destroying the buffalo they rely on for survival.

A short, sleeveless, loose-fitting [[nightgown]] or [[negligee]], intended as nightwear for women.

Common features include [[spaghetti strap]]s, [[empire waist]], [[see-through clothes|see-through]] fabric, and a [[front slit]] that reveals the [[midriff]]. It sometimes has formed cups (called a bralette) for cleavage and an attached loose fitting skirt falling in length usually between the upper thigh and the [[navel]]. title: bartholomew_roberts_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He first appeared as an NPC in the [[Madou Meihou-sou no Kousatsu]] event before being introduced as a playable servant in the 5th anniversary.

A Welsh pirate who raided ships around the Americas and West Africa, and considered to be the most successful pirate of the Golden Age of Piracy as determined by the number of captured ships. He was killed by a grapeshot cannon during a naval battle and had his corpse thrown overboard so he could be buried at sea.

He is also known as [b]Black Bart[/b] or [b]Salazar[/b]. Loves [[hair over one eye|mekakure]] girls.

title: the_turner_diaries
body:
The Turner Diaries is a 1978 novel by [[William Luther Pierce]], the founder and chairman of [[National Alliance]], an American white nationalist group, published under the pseudonym Andrew Macdonald. It was initially syndicated in the National Alliance publication Attack! from 1975–1978 before being published in paperback form by the National Alliance's publishing arm National Vanguard Books in 1978. As of 2001, the book had sold an estimated 300,000 copies, initially only available through mail order from the National Alliance. In 1996, it was republished by Barricade Books with a foreword that disavowed the novel. The Turner Diaries was described as being "explicitly racist and anti-Semitic" by [[The New York Times]].

The book has been influential in shaping white nationalism and the later development of the white genocide conspiracy theory. It has also inspired numerous hate crimes and acts of terrorism, including the 1984 assassination of [[Alan Berg]], the [[1995 Oklahoma City bombing]], and the [[1999 London nail bombings]]. It is estimated to have influenced perpetrators in over 200 killings. The phrase the "Day of the Rope" has also become popular in far-right and white nationalist circles.

title: picot_trim_panties
body:
[[Panties]] with a picot trim. Often seen in [[lingerie]].

Picot trim is a type of ornamental used in textiles and crafting. Picot trim typically features a decorative edging composed by a series of small loops or scallops along the edge of a fabric or ribbon.

The term "picot" originates from the French word for "small point". 

h4. Examples

body:

Summoned alongside [[Apollo (fate)|]] as a [[sheep]] [[stuffed animal|mascot]], similarly to [[Orion (Bear) (fate)|Orion]] with [[Artemis (fate)|]].
