title: grand_star_(mario)
body:
An oversized, extra-powerful variant of a [[Super Star (Mario)|Power Star]] that appears at key points in several [[Mario (series)|Mario]] titles. It’s literally a “grand” Power Star—larger, sporting round knobs at the tips, and packed with far more energy than an ordinary star.

h4. External links
* "Super Mario Wiki: Grand Star":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Grand_Star]

title: little_mermaid_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. Also known as "Siren", She is part of the [[Old Tales (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Cinderella (nikke)|]], [[Hansel (nikke)|]] & [[Gretel (nikke)|]], and [[Red Shoes (nikke)|]].

She has [[blue hair|dark blue]]/[[black hair]] which is [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]] set in [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] [[twintails]], and [[yellow eyes]]. She has a relatively tall and slender build compared to most Nikke, with [[medium breasts]]. She wears a blue/black [[skintight]], [[sleeveless]] [[halterneck]] [[backless_outfit|backless]] [[bodysuit]] with a hexagonal pattern, [[neon trim|neon-aqua highlights]] and [[see-through cleavage]], along with [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]].

[spoiler]She possesses a "Kotodama" akin to [[Maiden (nikke)|]]'s; her mark appears on her lower lip instead of tongue. Hers is still a prototype and she uses it with more difficulty and less control. In particular, it can activate unintentionally if she says the wrong thing (anything which could be construed as a command).[/spoiler]

For this reason (and in reference to her namesake), she does not speak under normal circumstances. [spoiler]She developed a means of controlling her ability by the time the event Unbreakable Sphere occurs.  While she is now able to freely speak to others, she still frequently responds by making simple sounds.[/spoiler]

Like her predecessors and her squad, she is named after the "folk tale of the same name":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Little_Mermaid].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8387547: Profile
* !post #9196516: [[little mermaid (abyss flower) (nikke)|Abyss Flower]]
other_names: リトルマーメイド(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: degrees_of_lewdity
body:
Open-source text-based erotic life simulation game about an orphan who must make enough money by any means possible to satisfy their abusive caretaker. Noted for its dark content and themes, including rape, abuse, bullying, kidnapping, prostitution, chastity, corruption, and bestiality.

The player character is customizable (and transformable), and all NPCs can be configured to be either gender and have either set of genitalia; moreover, NPCs' appearances are only briefly described in text, and therefore greatly open to interpretation.

title: jinnouchi_katsuhiko
body: The 40-year-old youngest son of Mansaku Jinnouchi. Katsuhiko is a member of Ueda's fire department and assists in the department's rescue squad.

title: jinnouchi_kunihiko
body: The 42-year-old middle son of Mansaku Jinnouchi. Kunihiko works as a fire sergeant in Suwa's fire department.

title: jinnouchi_yorihiko
body: The 45-year-old eldest son of Mansaku Jinnouchi. Yorihiko works as an emergency medical technician in Matsumoto's fire department.

title: magaki_(kof)
body:
The final boss of [[The King of Fighters XI]].

His normal form is that of a handsome white-haired man wearing a white tuxedo jacket. But in his transformed state, his lower body becomes covered in black metal, his skin becomes pink, his hair turns sharper, and his personality also changes to the point that he despises humans so much that they shouldn't even exist.

He fights by spamming lasers to the point the player cannot even have a chance to attack him, hence his SNK Boss status.

Fanworks often pair him with [[Touhou]]'s [[Patchouli Knowledge]].

title: alice_margatroid_(pc-98)
body:
The [[Touhou (PC-98)|Touhou PC-98]] version of [[Alice Margatroid]] as she appeared in [[Mystic Square]]. This version of Alice is [[aged down]] and has a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]].

Her connection with [[Shinki (touhou)|]] is typically assumed by fans to be a [[mother and daughter|mother-daughter]] relationship.

A popular nickname for Young Alice is Lolice, as in "Loli Alice."

h4. Appearance

* !post #2191177

title: looking_through_own_legs
body:
[[bent_over|Bending down]] and [[looking at viewer|looking at the viewer]] through one's own legs. Frequently seen when a character is standing up, with their head and torso fully bent forward so they are looking behind them upside-down. There are other possible poses, such as post #3323448, post #2860988, and post #3320641.

This is not the same as [[view between legs]] since that tag refers to the viewer's perspective. This tag refers to the character's perspective. The tags are not exclusive however as shown in post #3155529.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Posture]]
* [[downward dog]] (yoga pose)
* [[looking at viewer]]
* [[upside-down]]
* [[bent over]]
* [[from behind]]

title: nagao_kagetora_(fate)
body:
Lancer class servant who was first teased in [[Koha-Ace]] before appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[GUDAGUDA Final Honnouji 2019]] event. She later received a Ruler-class variant in the [[GUDAGUDA Chou Goryoukaku]] event.

[b]True Name:[/b] [[Uesugi Kenshin]], one of the most famous daimyo during the Sengoku era.
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Mizuki Nana]]

h4#intro. Intro

This is a list compiling named uniforms that are tagged on Danbooru. A uniform is defined as, "The distinctive clothing worn by members of the same organization or body, or by children attending certain schools." Therefore, different types of uniforms are compiled here, whether they be [[school uniform]]s, restaurant uniforms, [[military uniform]]s, sports uniforms, or otherwise outfits representing an organization or profession.

title: avery_(degrees_of_lewdity)
body:
A businessperson in [[Degrees of Lewdity]]. They are a love interest.

The player can choose their sex between [[Avery (male) (degrees of lewdity)|male]] and [[Avery (female) (degrees of lewdity)|female]].

title: mori_nagayoshi_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant of [[Major Matou]] in the manga [i][[koha-ace|Fate/KOHA-ACE]][/i]. He also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the [[GUDAGUDA Final Honnouji 2019]] event. In [[Fate/type Redline]], he is summoned by [[Magatsu Reiji]].

He wears a large suit of red [[armor]] that has maneuverable cables hanging from it. Underneath his [[helmet]], he has [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[red hair]] swept over an eye. His Noble Phantasm is the double-edged [[spear]] [[Ningen Mukotsu (fate)|]] (Boneless Man), which is said to cut through any armor.

[[Mysterious Ranmaru X (fate)|]] is a version of his younger brother Mori Ranmaru from the Servant Universe. He's also known by the nickname "Demon Musashi".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Keikenchi]], [[Dd (vktr4837)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Taniyama Kishou]]

title: hydra_(kirby)
body:
One of the legendary machines of [[Kirby Air Ride]] along with the [[Dragoon (kirby)|]]. The Hydra has a horned, green body with a glowing, flat area that serves a the seating. It also has two horn-shaped engines that are covered in spikes.

It can be used during the City Trial mode when a player assembles all three of its parts, boasting greater speed and superior offense and defense capabilities.
H4. See also
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Hydra

title: lolita_(nabokov)
body:
Umbrella tag for all iterations of [i]Lolita[/i], by Vladimir Nabokov.

Notable in history because Dolores Haze's nickname, Lolita, is the origin of the word "[[loli]]con". The term, being coined in Russell Trainer's pop psychology book The Lolita Complex (released 11 years after Lolita, 10 after the Japanese translation), would gain additional meaning in Japan beyond serving as a synonym for a [[pedophile]], being "used":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lETPaGnl2aI] equivalent to [[moe (phrase)|]] before that word gained traction in the 90s.

h4. Characters

* [[Dolores Haze]] (Lolita)
* [[Humbert Humbert]]

h4. Adaptations

* [[Lolita (1962)]]
* [[Lolita (1997)]]

title: dragoon_(kirby)
body:
One of the legendary machines of [[Kirby Air Ride]], along with the [[Hydra (kirby)|]]. The Dragoon has a white/light pink body and multiple rainbow feathers on its back.

It can be used during City Trial mode when a player assembles all three of its parts, granting them superior speed and flight capability. It also appears in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series with the same unlocking method, nearly guaranteeing a K.O. against targets on its path. The same distinction in this series is shared with the [[Daybreak (kid_icarus)|]].
H4. See also
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Dragoon

title: yoru_mac
body:
[[McDonald's]] Japan's post-5pm menu line-up, known as Yoru Mac (literally "Night Mac", with the alternate name of "McDonald's in the Night"), introduced in June 2017 first in Aichi, Gifu and Mie Prefecture, before being expanded nation-wide in March 2018. Several different products have come and gone as part of the line-up, and in turn, so too have several advertising campaigns.

In Autumn 2023, one such advertisement campaign launched, running from late September to early November, focused on depicting characters (ex. a family, a group of friends, etc. hanging out together) happily enjoying items from the line-up, in commercials animated by [[uraura ura-chan]]. The main mascots of the campaign are a set of Halloween characters, originally first appearing in a Spring 2023 Yoru Mac advertising campaign called "Yoru Mac Manager", even receiving their own dedicated commercial (post #6713997). The six commercials that released would collectively be entitled the "Yoru Mac Anime Series" by McDonald's.

One of the commercials, depicting a [[mother (yoru mac)|]], [[father (yoru mac)|]] and [[daughter (yoru mac)|]] (post #6702154), unexpectedly went viral on western Twitter, resulting in tons of fanart. Later, another commercial featuring a [[boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[girlfriend (yoru mac)|]] (post #6834868) received similar amounts of attention.

A year later, in Autumn 2024, coinciding with the "McDonald's Favorite Character Grand Prix":[https://twitter.com/McDonaldsJapan/status/1834766516807475527], another commercial featuring the family from the first commercial was made (post #8169424), with the Halloween character keychains being swapped out for a Grimace keychain.

h4. List of animated commercials

h5. 2023 Yoru Mac Anime Series

* post #6702154: [[Mother (yoru mac)|]], [[Father (yoru mac)|]] and [[Daughter (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6706301: Three Friends
* post #6713997: [[Dracula (yoru mac)|]], [[Frankenstein's Monster (yoru mac)|]], [[Mummy (yoru mac)|]], [[Werewolf (yoru mac)|]], and [[Witch (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6834868: [[Boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[Girlfriend (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6840960: [[Fry-kun (yoru mac)|]], [[Fry-chan (yoru mac)|]], and [[Nugget-kun (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6847978: [[Single Gal (yoru mac)|]]

h5. 2024 commercials

* post #8169424: [[Mother (yoru mac)|]], [[Father (yoru mac)|]] and [[Daughter (yoru mac)|]]
* post #8178340: Three Friends
* post #8197327: [[Boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[Girlfriend (yoru mac)|]]

h4. External links

* "grape Japan: McDonald’s Japan reveals little known moneysaver on their exclusive nighttime menu":[https://grapeejapan.com/209553]
* "McDonald's Japan: Yoru Mac (English)":[https://www.mcdonalds.co.jp/en/menu/dinner/]

title: fire_flower
body: In [[Nintendo|Nintendo's]] [[Mario (series)|]] franchise, a powerup that enables the player character to shoot balls of fire. Either depicted as a side-view three-lobed flower with 'smiling eyes,' or a disc-like flower with white-yellow-red or red-yellow-white bands of color.

title: ice_flower_(mario)
body: In [[Nintendo|Nintendo's]] [[Mario (series)|]] franchise, a powerup that enables the player character to shoot balls that freeze enemies. Its appearance is similar to that of the [[Fire Flower]], except with shades of blue in place of red/yellow.

title: mioda_ibuki
body:
A character from [[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]], titled the Ultimate Musician (超高校級の「軽音楽部」). A former member of Black Cherry, a popular girl group, Ibuki is currently pursuing a solo career. Despite her loud appearance, Ibuki is very upbeat and energetic, acting as a moodmaker for the rest of the students. She has a style that is a mix of [[punk]] and [[scene fashion]].

Ibuki has [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[black hair|black]], [[blue hair|blue]], [[pink hair|pink]] and [[white hair|white]]) with formed [[hair horns]], [[pink eyes]] and [[mouth piercing|mouth]] [[piercing|piercings]]. She wears a [[serafuku]], [[mismatched legwear|differently colored]] [[torn legwear|torn]] [[thighhighs]] and a [[necklace]]. She has a [[stitches|stitched]] [[scar]] on her thigh (it’s actually a [[tattoo]]).

title: over-kneehighs
body:
[[Socks]] or stockings that end just above the knee. In comparison to regular [[thighhighs]], they are shorter and leave a larger gap between the legwear and the [[skirt]] or [[dress]] in cases of [[zettai ryouiki]].

Judge length based on the distance from the top of the legwear and the knee, not the size of the gap. Combinations of certain clothing with full thighhighs can also produce a sizable area of exposed skin.

See post #86570 for reference, read the translation notes.

h4. Examples

* !post #2912271
* !post #3512088
* !post #5449019

h4. See also

* [[Thighhighs]]

title: buruma
body:
A type of [[underwear]]-like gym shorts, typically worn as part of a [[gym uniform]] with a [[gym shirt]].

"Buruma" is an English-to-Japanese-to-English transliteration of the word "bloomer", usually identifying an over-panty or public garment, whose purpose is to cover the panty and crotch area while leaving the maximum maneuvering room.

In real life, buruma are rarely part of a [[gym uniform]] these days since they're considered old-fashioned; however, they still show up in anime since they are fetishized by otaku.  

The buruma has become a feature internationally in women's [[track and field]] and other sports uniforms. Though the design and materials may be different, the "racing buruma" as they are known in Japan, serve the same purpose and have the same brief shape. 

Contrast with [[bloomers]], which are a type of underwear constructed much like boxer shorts worn by women.

h4. See also

* [[gym uniform]]
* [[bloomers]]
* [[dolphin shorts]]
* [[short shorts]]
* [[sports bikini]]
* [[track uniform]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Buruma":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/buruma]

title: gundam_gp-01_full_vernian_zephyranthes
body:
[b]RX-78GP01Fb Full Vernian "Zephyranthes"[/b]

A refit to the original spec [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] designed with space combat in mind after [[Kou Uraki]] heavily damaged the unit attempting to haphazardly send it into combat. With added verniers and thrusters, the Full Vernian (also referred to erroneously as the [i]Full Burnern[/i]) was a high-mobility, all-round top-class MS.

A black-and-white variant of its HGUC model kit was included as a Limited Edition bonus together with [[Linkin Park]]'s "A Thousand Suns" to commemorate "The Catalyst" being used as the opening for the arcade and PS3 game "Mobile Suit Gundam: Extreme Versus".

title: ufo_skirt
body:
A type of [[skirt]] closely associated with [[cyber fashion]], [[rave party|rave]]s, and [[science fiction]]. It has a [[flying saucer]]-like shape with a flared edge, and a smooth surface without pleats. 

Often made of [[shiny clothes|shiny]] or [[see-through skirt|translucent]] material.

h4. See also

* [[bubble skirt]]
* [[circle skirt]]

title: circle_skirt
body:
When a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] is spread out in a circle, maybe looking like a disk. The reason for this can vary:

* The dress is inherently designed to fan out like a disk on its own (post #3474471, post #8319807, post #1065045)
* The character is sitting down/kneeling/lying and spreading the dress around them (post #4551021, post #1170148, post #1140590)
* The [[dress lift|dress lifted]] or [[wind lift]] upward and spread flat (post #2579102, post #45559, post #2102833, post #7388110)
* The perspective is shown above the character (post #1997121, post #4023640, post #7932819)
* Similarly, it can be an [[upskirt]] where other elements like the wind or the character's legs assist in spreading the dress around (post #1121623, post #7601362, post #2372870)

h4. See Also

* [[dress flip]]
* [[dress lift]]
* [[skirt flip]]
* [[skirt lift]]
* [[wind lift]]
* [[floating clothes]]
* [[ufo skirt]]

title: impossible_shirt
body:
A [[shirt]] that is unrealistically [[skin tight]] around the breasts, hugging the breasts on all sides. The shirt is impossible because normal clothes could never be this form-fitting without having two empty sacks where the breasts would go.

Not to be confused with [[taut shirt]] or [[tight shirt]]. A [[tight shirt]] is tight, but not skin tight around the breasts. A [[taut shirt]] is a shirt that has ripples from the fabric hanging taut between the breasts.

title: arjuna_alter_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. An [[Alter servant|Alter]] version of [[Arjuna (Fate)|]].

He has [[silver hair|silver]] or [[black hair]], [[grey eyes|grey]] or [[brown eyes]], [[dark skin]], [[horns]], [[wings]] and a [[tail]]. Wears [[pants]] and [[boots]] across all Ascensions.

[spoiler]Arjuna Alter is the result of the entire Hindu Pantheon (sans Kama/Mara) conglomerating in the body of the hero Arjuna. Appears as one of the main villains of Lostbelt nr. 4: Yugakshetra. Arjuna Alter is the king of the Indian Lostbelt; having been manipulated by [[Ashiya Douman (Fate)|Ashiya Douman]], he has been accelerating the Saṃsāra of Genesis and Terminus to the point of time-space growing unstable, all for the sake of a perfect world without evil.

When he finally fights his rival and half-brother [[Karna (fate)|]] in the climactic showdown, Arjuna Alter loses his usual cool and becomes dead-set on exterminating Karna once and for all.[/spoiler]

title: bridget_(guilty_gear)
body:
A character from the [[Guilty Gear]] fighting game series. First appearing in [[Guilty Gear XX]], born as one of two male twins in an [[united kingdom|English]] village where the birth of same-sex twins was considered bad luck, they were raised as a girl, prompting their [[otoko no ko]] appearance. 

Throughout [i]Guilty Gear XX[/i], they would reject the stigma of their upbringing and work towards proving their masculinity as a bounty hunter. Years later, as of [i][[Guilty Gear Strive]][/i], Bridget had since succeeded, dispelling the superstition of their village. In absence of that purpose, they experience unresolved doubts, ultimately determining to be true to herself, embracing her identity as a girl across the conclusions of her story.

Debuted in [i]XX[/i] with a sleeveless and shortened [[nun]] habit (for ease of movement, not because they are a nun), a giant handcuff as an accessory, and [[bike shorts]]. In [i]Strive[/i], the nun habit is replaced with a similar [[hooded jacket]], with the habit's [[mars symbol]], pointed to the upper-right, changed to an [[androgyne symbol]], pointed to the upper-left, matching the orientations of these elements as in the [[transgender symbol|⚧ symbol]]. In either case, they wield a [[yo-yo]] and their pet [[teddy bear]] [[Roger (Guilty Gear)|]] in battle.

[i]Current policy is to tag Bridget as male unless physical evidence in the image proves otherwise, including the presence of the [[transgender flag]]. Non-bodily evidence (e.g. [[transgender flag]]) is only relevant to {{Rating:General}} posts.[/i]

h4. External links

* "Arc System Works: Bridget":[https://www.guiltygear.com/ggst/en/character/bgt/]
* "Arc System Works: 11th volume of “Developer’s Backyard” (9/14 Release)":[https://www.guiltygear.com/ggst/en/news/post-1657/]
* Interview with Ishiwatari Daisuke and Katano Akira about Bridget: "Part 1":[https://newsdig.tbs.co.jp/articles/-/186739?display=1] "Part 2":[https://newsdig.tbs.co.jp/articles/-/186744?display=1]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: ブリジット(ギルティギア)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/ブリジット(ギルティギア)]

title: chozo
body:
Humanoid bird-like entities that raised [[Samus Aran]] when she lost her parents. They are responsible for the creation of Samus's [[power suit (metroid)|]] and many relics in the [[Metroid]] universe, such as [[chozo statue|statues]], most [[power-up|]]s in the series, and the titular [[Metroid (creature)|]].

Believed to be extinct. The only living chozo met [[metroid dread|in game]] are [[Quiet Robe (metroid)|]] and [[Raven Beak (metroid)|]].

title: yukadon
body:
One character slapping their hands against the ground while the other character is [[lying]] [[on back|on their back]], effectively [[pinned|pinning]] them. Commonly in a [[kneeling]] and [[arm support]] position.

Use [[yukadon on viewer]] for a yukadon in [[pov| first person]].

It is basically the lying down version of [[kabedon]]. Variants include [[on ground]], [[on floor]], [[on bed]], [[on table]]/[[on desk]], etc. Use [[kabedon]] if it's not distinguishable whether the character is standing or lying.

h4. See also

* [[kabedon]]

title: kabedon
body:
Kabedon (Japanese: 壁ドン; kabe, "wall", and don, "bang") is the popular trope of one character slapping their hand against the wall while the other character's back is currently against it, effectively locking them in. It is usually employed for romantic purposes.

When a foot is used instead of a hand, also use [[foot kabedon]]. Use [[kabedon on viewer]] for a kabedon in [[pov| first person]].

For the variant done while [[lying]], use [[yukadon]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[against wall]]
* [[assertive female]]
* [[cicada block (meme)|]]
* [[lauren phillips lifting alice merchesi (meme)|]]
* [[face-to-face]]

title: gray_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. One of the main characters in [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]]. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she is summonable as a Assassin-class Servant.

She is an assistant of [[Lord El-Melloi II]] at the Mage's Association's Clock Tower. She first met Lord El-Melloi II when he arrived in her hometown. She became his apprentice, and was admitted to the Clock Tower of London.

She has a striking resemblance to [[Saber (fate)|]], which Lord El-Melloi II believes is because she's a distant descendant of King Arthur. Her face brings unpleasant memories of the Fourth Holy Grail War for him, so he tells her to wear a hood to hide her face.

Gray has possession of the Noble Phantasm [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]], the holy lance of King Arthur, that has been passed down through the generations by preserving its mystery through a similar manner to the Tradition Carrier trait held by the Fraga family.

Gray also possess a unique Mystic Code called [[Add (fate)|]].

She is about 15 years old in the events of Adra Castle Case. In [[Fate/strange fake]], she appears in her early twenties. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she's introduced as an Assassin-class Servant in the [i]Case Files[/i] collaboration event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sakamoto Mineji]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ueda Reina]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #5038704: [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]]

title: astraea_(fate)
body:
Ruler-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the daughter of Astraeus and Eos, and is the virgin goddess of justice, innocence, purity and precision. She is a Pseudo-Servant who takes on the body of [[Luviagelita Edelfelt]]. She can be distinguished from Luvia due to her [[drill hair]] being thicker and having [[blue hair|blue tips]]. Only tag both if they both appear in the image or one is [[cosplay]]ing the other.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Azuma Toh]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Itou Shizuka]]

title: reines_el-melloi_archisorte
body:
A relative of [[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald]], belonging to the Archisorte branch of the family. [spoiler]After his death, she is selected as heir-apparent of the house of El-Melloi. She appoints [[Waver Velvet]] as her step-brother and steward to the title as [[Lord El-Melloi II]] until she is of proper age to assume it herself.[/spoiler] When using her [[Mystic Eyes]], her [[aqua eyes]] turn [[red eyes|red]].

A [[aged down]], [[short hair|short-haired]] version of her appears in episode 1 of the [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]] anime and the special episode.

She first appeared in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] before being featured as a main character in [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]]. She can be summoned in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as a Rider-class Pseudo-Servant, with [[Sima Yi]] of [i]Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/i] inhabiting her body.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]], [[Sakamoto Mineji]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Minase Inori]]

title: gymnastics
body:
Gymnastics includes physical exercises requiring [[balancing|balance]], strength, [[flexible|flexibility]] and coordination. If a gymnast is using a [[rope]], [[hoop]], [[ball]], [[juggling club]] or [[ribbon baton]], tag [[rhythmic gymnastics]] too.

The modern sport of gymnastics (i.e. as a competitive sport) is divided by sex

h5. For women 
* [[Balance beam]]
* [[Vaulting horse]] 
* [[uneven bars (gymnastics) |Uneven bars]]
* Floor

h5. For men
* [[parallel bars| Horizontal and parallel bars]]
* [[Gymnastics ring]]s
* Pommel horse 
* Floor

title: predator_(series)
body:
A [[science fiction]] action/thriller media franchise produced by [[20th century studios|20th Century Studios]]. Primarily revolves around the titular [[predator (character)|species of]] [[alien]] and their encounters with humans and other alien species who they hunted for sport.

Three more sequels were produced after the [[Predator (1987)|1987 movie of the same name]], called [i][[Predator 2]][/i] (1990), [i][[Predators (2010)|]][/i] (2010) and [i]The Predator[/i] (2018) respectively. A prequel set before the previous movies, titled [[Prey (predator)|]] directed by Dan Trachtenberg, was released in 2022. Due to Prey's positive reviews, Trachtenberg would return to direct two new Predator movies, Predator: Killer of Killers, an animated anthology movie, and Predator: Badlands, a live action movie set in the future, with both movies set to be released in 2025 on Hulu and theaters respectively.

Often has a crossover with the [[Alien (series)|]] franchise.

h4. See also
* [[Alien vs. Predator]]

title: nozomi_(blue_archive)
body:
A student from and [[train conductor|conductor]] of the Highlander Railway Academy in [[Blue Archive]]. Can be differentiated from her twin sister [[Hikari (blue archive)|]] by her [[twintails]] and [[short shorts]].

Her full name is Tachibana Nozomi.

Her and her sister's names are based on the real-life "Hikari":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hikari_(train)] and "Nozomi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nozomi_(train)] [[shinkansen]] operated by the [[Japan Railways]] group.

She and her sister are often referred to by the fandom as "shupogaki", a portmanteau of the Japanese onomatopoeia for the sound a train makes (choo choo) and gaki (brat).

Voiced by: [[Hoshitani Mio]]
Original artist: [[CHILD (isoliya)]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #9185200: Profile

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Nozomi":https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Nozomi
other_names: ハイランダー鉄道学園

title: fergus_mac_roich_(fate)
body:
Saber-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

A character from the Ulster cycle of Irish mythology, he is the former king of Ulster who was tricked out of his kingship, and then later became the ally and lover of [[Medb (fate)|]]. He helped raise his nephew [[Cu chulainn (fate/stay night)|]], and is known to be a huge womanizer. He wields the spiral sword [[Caladbolg (fate)|]].

He has a younger version of himself, known as [[Fergus mac Roich (young) (fate)|]], who behaves nothing like his adult self.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[B Suke]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kuroda Takaya]]

title: large_clitoris
body:
A [[clitoris]] that is prominently large, but not unrealistic.  May protrude prominently from the [[clitoral hood]].

In humans testosterone can enlarge the clitoris. Some may purposefully make their clitoris larger as a body modification. Female [[bodybuilder]]s who use steroids may experience this unintentionally. Transgender men who take testosterone as hormone replacement may purposefully seek out this result. Some posts under [[cuntboy]] may depict transgender man, making the tag applicable in those cases. In transgender men, this is colloquially referred to as a "t-dick".

h4. See also

* [[huge clitoris]]

title: huge_clitoris
body:
A [[clitoris]] that is unusually large, beyond what is realistic. May resemble an erect penis. 

See [[large clitoris]] for large clitorises that are still realistic.

h4. See also

* [[clitoris pump]]
* [[erect clitoris]]
* [[futanari]]
* [[pseudopenis]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Clitoral enlargement methods":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clitoral_enlargement_methods]

title: female_ejaculation
body:
The expulsion of [[pussy juice|fluid]] from the [[pussy|vagina]] during or after an [[female orgasm|orgasm]]. Colloquially known as 'squirting' or 'gushing'.

It can be hard to tell whether an image contains female ejaculation or [[peeing]], especially if the picture is [[monochrome]]. Female ejaculate is usually drawn white or clear as a strong gush, and there will usually be less of it than there would be if the subject was peeing. If you aren't sure which it is, use your best judgment when tagging. 

Not to be confused with the [[squirting liquid]] tag, which is for non-sexual expulsion of liquids. This tag implies a vagina, in case of a [[futanari]] ejaculating  [[ejaculating while penetrated]] shall be used instead.

h4. See also

* [[pussy juice]]
* [[female orgasm]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Female ejaculation":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Female_ejaculation]

title: petite
body:
A relatively small female body type that still retains developed body features such as slightly curvy hips.

Tall women are not petite even if they are slender. Such images should be tagged [[skinny]].

Petite should only be used for people of natural size. An exceptionally small person should instead be tagged [[minigirl]].

Petite women with exceptionally [[curvy]] bodies and [[wide hips]] should be tagged as [[shortstack]]s.

For female characters that appear fully prepubescent, use [[child]] if the image is rated general or sensitive, depending on the situation as long they are not sexually depicted, otherwise use [[loli]] if the image is rated questionable or explicit. See [[howto:rate]] for more.

h4. Examples

* [[Baba Konomi]] and [[Kusakabe Wakaba]] from [[Idolmaster]]
* [[Colorado (kancolle)|]] and [[Maryland (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]]
* [[Papi (monster musume)|]] from [[Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou]]
* [[Rebecca (cyberpunk)|]] from [[Cyberpunk Edgerunners]]
* [[Shuten Douji (fate)|]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]]
* [[Tatsumaki]] from [[One-Punch Man]]

title: tamamo_no_mae_(swimsuit_lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[tamamo no mae (fate/extra)| Tamamo no Mae]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]] for the [[Chaldea Summer Memory|2016 Summer Event]]. She wears a [[blue bikini]] [[bikini under clothes|underneath]] a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]], a [[straw hat]], an [[innertube]] for her tail, and a [[towel]] that bears her name. Her weapon is a [[parasol]] thereby classifying her as a Lancer.

The bikini and wet t-shirt combination that she wears in her Second Ascension was later released as a DLC costume in [[Fate/Extella Link]], given the name [b]Beach Flower[/b].

Do not add the [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate/Extra)]] tag if Tamamo Lancer is by herself. They are treated as separated characters and should only be tagged together if they both appear in an image, or one is [[cosplay]]ing as the other.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Chiwa]]

title: leonardo_da_vinci_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Appears as part of [[Chaldea Security Organization]]'s staff, being their 3rd successful heroic spirit summon. While male in life, da Vinci chose to embody the appearance of the [[Mona Lisa]] painting that he worked on during his life, as genius has no gender.

After the events of the Part 2 Prologue [spoiler]wherein she is murdered by [[Rasputin (fate)|]][/spoiler], a younger [[Leonardo da Vinci (Rider) (fate)|Rider-class version]] of her appears instead.

title: tawara_touta_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. Also known as Fujiwara no Hidesato, he is famous for his military exploits, particularly when he shot down a giant centipede that plagued the Dragon Palace in Omi Province.

The bale he is often seen carrying over his shoulder is a [[komedawara]], which was one of the gifts given to him.

body:
An Archer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. One of the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]]. title: lancelot_(fate/grand_order)
body:
A Saber-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity.

One of the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]]. [spoiler]An ideal version of [[Berserker (fate/zero)|Fate/Zero's Berserker]] before he went mad after being pardoned by [[saber (fate)|his king]] for his affair with [[Guinevere (fate)|]].[/spoiler] He wears [[purple armor|purple]] or [[white armor]] and has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]].

Often paired with [[Mash Kyrielight]] [spoiler]since the latter was fused with Galahad, who is the son of Lancelot.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Shimadoriru]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Okiayu Ryoutarou]]

title: nitocris_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. The semi-legendary pharaoh of [[ancient Egyptian|ancient Egypt]] known for her legend of her revenge against the conspirator who killed her brother and her depiction in various fictional works as the queen who helds the power of an evil and otherworldly beings. 

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]] with [[extra ears|extra]] [[jackal ears]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Shima Udon]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tanaka Minami (voice actor)|]]

title: lion_king_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer) (Fate)|]], a Lancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She wields [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|Rhongomyniad]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|Excalibur]].

This version of Artoria is as she appears in [spoilers]the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity of Fate/Grand Order, who is actually the Goddess Rhongomyniad.[/spoilers] One physical difference from the original is that her eyes are [[empty eyes|lifeless]] and colored bright lime green, with [[bright pupils|glowing pupils]]. A good example of this is post #3835074. She might also sport an [[expressionless]] face, be shown with a white colored cape and in her First Ascension she will have a helmet with white fur. Regular Lancer Artoria uses a red cape and yellow fur.

She can also summon her horse named [[Dun Stallion (fate)|]] and is associated with the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]]. 

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ishida Akira]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: mag_agent_v4
body:
The fourth iteration of mag agents in the [[Madness Combat]] series.

As with all mag agents, their size is more than twice that of any normal agent, and they wear [[black suit]]s. This version possesses a [[rectangular eyewear|rectangular]] [[red visor]] covering most of their face with straps securing it in place behind the head.

title: ibaraki_douji_(fate)
body:
An [[oni]] Berserker-class Servant appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first appearing as a boss in the [[Kikoku Suimu Makyou Rashoumon]] event before being introduced as a playable servant in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] event.

Her Noble Phantasm is Rashoumon Dai Engi. Has red-tinted hands and feet, and carries a bone sword. The first "Raid Boss" in Fate/Grand Order, her story is later expanded upon in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] and [[Halloween Comeback!|Halloween 2016]] (where it is revealed that she secretly likes sweets) events. Holds a deep grudge against [[Watanabe no Tsuna (fate)|]] for cutting off her hand, in the original mythology.

She is nicknamed "banana oni" by the fanbase due to her overall yellow color scheme and her wide forehead which seamlessly transitioned into her hair, giving her a very smooth forehead.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Hidari (Left Side)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Touyama Nao]]

title: grunt_(madness_combat)
body:
A featureless character from the [[Madness Combat]] series, which can be considered a template for any human in the series.

At base, all grunts and (most) humans will have pale [[grey skin]], a + covering [[faceless|their entire face]], [[rayman limbs]], and a tall torso. Every grunt has grey featureless clothes and no hair.

title: xuangzang_sanzang_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Hoshi no Sanzang-chan Tenjiku ni Iku]] event. The Buddhist monk from [i][[Journey to the West]][/i]. Her [[genderswap|genderswapped]] design is a nod to the Japanese TV adaptation of [i]Journey to the West[/i] that usually chooses an actress to portray Sanzang. Also known as Xuanzang Sanzang, [[Tang Sanzang]] or Genjou Sanzou (Japanese reading).

An air-headed country girl. She only wears a [[bikini]] and a Buddhist [[robe]] in the game since she feels that the usual monk robe is "too hot and uncomfortable".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Okazaki Takeshi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Komatsu Mikako]]

title: parlor_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Wind
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned : You can send 1 " Dragonmaid " card from your Deck to the GY , except "Parlor Dragonmaid". At the start of the Battle Phase : You can return this card to the hand , and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 8 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Parlor Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1700

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Lorpar]] in her dragon form. She has a plant theming to her, complete with a leafy tail and wings.

Parlor Dragonmaid is notorious for binging on sweets to the point where she steals some behind [[Kitchen Dragonmaid]]'s back and even petitions her for more sweets. In fan arts, she is also often depicted as a sister figure to [[Laundry Dragonmaid]].
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・パルラ

title: nurse_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 2
[b]Attribute:[/b] Earth
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned : You can target 1 Level 4 or lower " Dragonmaid " monster in your GY , except "Nurse Dragonmaid"; Special Summon it. At the start of the Battle Phase : You can return this card to the hand , and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Nurse Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1600

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Dragonmaid" archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Ernus]] in her dragon form. Easily recognised by her pink [[nurse]] uniform. Nurse Dragonmaid appears as a careful and kind senior figure, or even as a sisterly figure, as she is often depicted caring for or worrying about [[Laundry Dragonmaid]] in official card art.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・ナサリー

title: minamoto_no_raikou_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] event. Wields a [[katana]] and [[bow (weapon)|bow]]. Resembles [[Suzuhara Misae]] from [[Mahou Shoujo (Raita)|Zettai Junpaku Mahou Shoujo]]. Allied with [[sakata kintoki (fate)|Sakata Kintoki]] and rivals with [[Shuten Douji (fate)|Shuten-Douji]].

Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[low-tied long hair|tied at the end]], and [[purple eyes]]. Wears a [[purple bodysuit]] with [[ribbed sleeves]] and [[tabard]] and/or [[loincloth]], with red [[rope]] at various areas. Also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[kote]], and black [[sandals]] with [[suneate]]. Overall she appears as a tall, [[curvy]] woman, with either [[large breasts|large]] or [[huge breasts]]. Has a [[motherly]] personality.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Honjou Raita]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tomatsu Haruka]]

title: hank_j._wimbleton
body:
Main protagonist of the [[Madness Combat]] series. His appearance differs between installments, but tends to be frequently portrayed outside of the main story with his outfit from Madness Combat 7: [i]Consternation[/i].

Said outfit consists of a pair of [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[goggles]] with a [[red-tinted eyewear|red tint]], a [[black coat]] and [[black bandana]]s covering his head and mouth, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[bandages]] covering the wounds* received since the first installment.

* For reference purposes, the list of wounds can be found at "this link":[https://madnesscombat.fandom.com/wiki/Hank_J._Wimbleton#Deaths] ([b]Warning: Spoilers[/b]).
other_names: ハンク・J・ウィンブルトン

title: seiko-chan_cut_(hairstyle)
body:
Layered, feathered hairstyle popularized by Japanese idol and singer [[Matsuda Seiko]]. Popular among young Japanese women in the 80s, though considered dated nowadays. Modern takes on the hairstyle may be feathered more outwards with less inward curling/perming, resembling Farah Fawcett's iconic hairstyle more.

* !asset #25623938: The original 80s-style Seiko-chan cut.

title: haiseiko_(umamusume)
body:
NPC Character from [[Umamusume]]. She is effectively Japan's first "umadol", having successfully made the crossover from the Regionals to Central and caused the "Haiseiko Boom" (this is the same career path [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]] would take afterwards, taking the fan boom to new heights).
[spoiler]Her appearance is ostensibly based on [[Matsuda Seiko]], given her [[name connection|namesake]] and time of popularity.[/spoiler]

In game, she is the very reason why [[Smart Falcon (umamusume)|]] taken the path to become an umadol.

Voiced by [[Tange Sakura]].

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Haiseiko":[https://umamusume.jp/character/haiseiko]
